Title: Very happy with purchase
Review Comment: Finally my family is no longer complaining about WiFi access speeds.  Compared to Small Office/Home Office routers which I've purchased over the years this product was easy to set up and configure and works reliably. Very happy and have recommended it to co-workers and friends who have family embers frustrated with lack of signal in some parts of the house.  I was a little concerned about maintaining enough bandwidth for VOIP but have had no problems so far.

Title: Replacement for Three TP-Link range extenders
Review Comment: I bought the three unit mesh network to replace three TP-Link POE range extenders.  The range extenders would occasionally drop signals and force me to use a different SSID when I needed a better signal (depending upon the location).  The eero units worked out of the box and provided much better and stronger coverage than the range extenders.  Setup was easy using my Android smartphone.  The only problem I had was with my  Canon wireless printer.  The eero installation sets up a new network with a different IP address scheme.  After installation, I could no longer print because the printer was not "discovered".  I had to reset the printer settings and re-install the drivers after pulling the plugs on two eero units.  I needed to pull the plugs because the eero units use the same SSID for each unit.  The printer install would not let me install initially because of the duplicate SSIDs.  Temporarily removing two eero units allowed me to connect the printer to a single unit and finish the install.  Once the printer install was done, I re-plugged the two units and all is well.

Title: Your mileage may vary
Review Comment: I struggle w/ 4 or 5 stars. I am a engineer and my network maybe was a bit different then the intended audience and I want to be fair if this is at all the cause for my challenges. That being said, if you are looking for a simple to use wifi mesh that will cover a large square footage home, this is a great product and dead simple to install. My only complaint is after initial install the app stated that "Everything Looks Good" although I was unable to pass traffic from any wireless connected device. It was not until I went into "Help-->My Internet is slow-->Run Health Check" that there was a sign of an issue. I just found this very misleading and as a technical person I did know howto logically troubleshoot but would my friend or family member or would this be a call to the guy who recommends it, me ? The other issue was an undocumented feature that suddenly appeared after a software update that now my wireless devices can not converse with my wired devices, this presents an issue because my wired device is my desktop/media server and now none of my devices can do app hand off in spotify to my desktop.  Another EXCELLENT win for this solution is support, I spoke with a girl who was extremely knowledgeable and courteous and would say this is the best consumer network device support in the industry right now.  Please keep in mind, if you have a very simple cable modem and wireless setup, you may have no issues but I have a cable modem, router, switch, wired VoIP, wired desktops, and now Eero for wifi and there are some challenges.

Title: Issue with Arris 6183 cable modem
Review Comment: Incompatible with Arris 6183 cable modem.  Major issue, not disclosed.  Serious pain to deal with.

Title: OMG. It was worth it.
Review Comment: Our wi-fi throughout the house is SO much better. This was a great purchase.

Title: Greatly improved wifi coverage
Review Comment: Using the 3 eero set up we have excellent wifi coverage in our 2 story house plus separate guest house. Very much better than the prior wifi solution with a modem/router and separate wifi extender. Much stronger and now not requiring different and confusing connections and passwords.

Title: Wow.
Review Comment: Attractive industrial design, fantastic software UI/UX, easy setup, rock-solid reliability and performance. This blows traditional routers out of the water and I'm amazed. You can tell the product was made by people who care and were out to solve once and for all the headaches of home wifi systems. Might be a bit overkill for smaller homes/apartments, but worth every penny in terms of performance and peace of mind.

Title: Happy with Eero
Review Comment: Was comparing Linksys Velop, Orbi and Eero, I haven't actually tried the products but basically decided based on one factor, the size. The reviews are pretty much the same for all of them, solid wifi that blankets your home. So I got the Eero and yes, they kinda hide on my bookshelf along with my books, can't even notice it, set up was super easy, I now have fast blazing speed connection without interruption everywhere in my house, even in my driveway:)

Title: Works great, as advertised.
Review Comment: fully met my expectations; after poor performance of my previous router, the eero system (3) took care of everything that may have been impacting  me before.  make sure you follow the instructions in the app all the way to the end, I did not and thus the systems was not fully set up; I contacted support when there was a mismatch of versions between software in the eero modules.  Support was excellent.

Title: Mesh is the answer
Review Comment: I think we all know the problems with traditional consumer wifi routers. The interface is complicated, it has to be re-booted periodically, and it doesn't cover your whole home. I am so happy with my new Eero wifi system. The set up is VERY easy. Been dreaming of something like this since I got my first 14.4k baud dial-up modem.

Title: Well Worth the Money!
Review Comment: We stopped renting the cable company modem and bought our own gateway connected to the eeros and we couldn't be happier!  We have 13 devices connected via wifi and run streaming music or video over 3 or 4 at the same time with no lag or interruption.  Moreover, our internet speed went from 20 Mbps to 50 - well worth the money!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: This is a great product. We now well connected throughout the house.

Title: Great product!
Review Comment: Works great and easy to set up. I called support because I had to set mine up differently than the default and someone answered the phone immediately with no waiting! The support person communicated clearly and was actually knowledgeable about the product. No sh... er, I mean, no kidding!!  Maybe I got lucky but so far this product is 5 BRIGHT stars!

Title: Pricey BUT so worth every penny!
Review Comment: SUPER easy to install. A package of 3 was perfect for our 2 story house.  One got directly connected to modem.  The other in main living room (for our Roku & gaming systems) and the last one went upstairs.  Created a nice mesh & we can see the difference.  Movies stream in Ultra HD 4K no prob.  A lil pricey, which hurt but the end result is awesome!

Title: Great product. Very easy to use
Review Comment: So far so good. I installed this in my boss' house. 9 bedroom, god knows how many sq feet. I replaced his apple airport stuff which was very spotty. It took nearly 3 mins to connect music to his 18 sonos speakers from an iPad before with airport set up (1 airport, 2 airport express'). I replaced all the apple stuff with an eero exactly where they were and not only is it instant to play music, but I would lose the groups all the time due to spotty connectivity atleast once a week, I haven't lost the groups in months.

Title: Bought the eero WiFi System and the whole house is covered with better than expected speed
Review Comment: Had an Apple AirPort Time Capsule which didn't cover two-stories at about 2,700 SF very well.  Bought the eero WiFi System and the whole house is covered with better than expected speed.  Download the iOS app for step-by-step walk through.  Tip:  Use the same network name and password and all the devices connect with ease.  Worth every dollar.  Now all four members of the family are happy and connected in all rooms in the house.  TVs, Macs, PCs, smartphones, game consoles, etc.

Title: If Consumer Reports likes a product it's a good product. I bought it on their recommendation
Review Comment: Not a computer headed geek, don't really understand all the computer jabber. I read about this product in Consumer Reports- only a few things you can always depend on in this nation today, the Military, Consumer Reports, and Toyota. If Consumer Reports likes a product it's a good product. I bought it on their recommendation, it works well, no more dead spots. Not a large house but rooms are small with many walls to block signals. Dead spots gone! A product that works as claimed.

Title: Best flipping WiFi ever!
Review Comment: The best I've ever had! I've always had problems with updates and firmware for years with all the big brand name "disposable" routers. I call them disposable because that's exactly what they are and I've gone through so many. Finally, Eero has nailed it! I've had the router for months now and it's connectivity is unfailing and superior, and fast! Hallelujah brother that created it! Love the app that works with the router, too. I bought only one because I live in an apartment.

Title: Set up was very easy. The only problem I had was that after ...
Review Comment: These appear to have resolved a problem of spotty wifi around my house.  Set up was very easy.  The only problem I had was that after getting these set up, they auto-updated the software and the app got frozen -- although the eeros themselves were working.  I finally deleted the app and reinstalled it and everything has been good since then.  I am surprised that I do get an occasional message when trying to use my iPad and my Apple TV, both in the same room as an eero, telling me that the signal is too weak.  There is a clear line of sight between all three devices and the Apple TV is close to the eero but a bit lower.  I'll experiment a bit with placement and assume this will be resolved.  Regardless, I would recommend these because of the design, ease of set up and blanket coverage elsewhere in my house.

Title: Exceeds expectations
Review Comment: We live in a 3-level, 4K+ sqft house.  The 3-pack has eliminated all dead spots.  The interface allows me to see who is using my system and then block them if I so choose.  We run mostly Apple devices and an Xbox seamlessly.  I installed this last October and have seen it improve over that time from initial download speeds in the 30-40s to what we have now.  Our download speeds after the last update are consistently over 100Mbps.  The system does seem to "learn" your house.

Title: Overheating eero units
Review Comment: The set I received was very easy to setup, and it worked great... for the first day. The next day I woke to find one of the units had overheated so I returned the set. I read online that everyone says they are very warm when on so I decided not to risk future failures and have decided to try the Linksys Velop system. Maybe when eero comes out with version 2 they will put in a better heatsink. I think they concentrated too much on aesthetics and not enough on functionality.

Title: My download speed is considerably better throughout our condo
Review Comment: This system does all it says it will.  My download speed is considerably better throughout our condo.  We now have no dead zones, and moving between rooms doesn't cause connection problems.  It is easy to set up, and configure, and so far I have gotten 2 software updates, something I never got with Linksys.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Easy to install and works extremely well.  Replaced all previous wifi routers.

Title: Great product, great Wifi coverage, easy to set up
Review Comment: Finally, no dead spots in my house!  I've tried many products to cover my 5000 sp ft two story home, but there were always dead spots.  Not any more.  after spending about 30 minutes experimenting with locations for my FOUR Eero's, I finally have whole house coverage without any dead spots.  It was very easy to set up and requires zero maintenance or updating so far (3 months).  It was worth spending nearly $000 to have zero Wifi headaches.

Title: Best purchase ever
Review Comment: Best purchase ever!!! No more connection issues. I live in an apartment complex its clean and I get to laugh at my neighbors who continue to buy extenders for their 2 bedroom units. Lol

Title: Garbage.
Review Comment: Garbage. I bought 5 to cover our whole house (5k square feet). constantly needing to be reset. eero support is no help. plugged in old asus and everything works flawlessly.

Title: Great easy-to-use wi-fi network
Review Comment: This has made wi-fi almost as fast and easy as wired service.  For the first time, I have very fast and uniform wi-fi service in our large old house.  The system was easy to install.  When I did have a glitch, I was able to get eero tech support on the phone quickly and talk to a very helpful real human being.  He guided me through resolution in just a few minutes.  This is a great device from a customer-friendly business.

Title: Excellent wifi system and excellent customer service.
Review Comment: Installed eeros in both our apartment and a vacation home. Both have multiple levels. In general only one is needed on each floor. The system works perfectly in both locations. Streaming is flawless. I had a problem with the installation of one of the units. Called customer service and a lovely woman walked me thru a fix. She stayed on the phone with me until we were sure it was working.

Title: Works great. Great coverage across my house and yard
Review Comment: I've had this for about 6 months now.  Works great.  Great coverage across my house and yard, and stable as a rock.I had a problem early on where some devices would just momentarily disconnect from the wifi and then reconnect (and page loads and stuff would time-out in between).  It was annoying, and started getting more frequent.  I contacted support, and they were very responsive.  They reported back that one of the units was reporting that it was overheating indicating that it might be defective, so they sent me a replacement unit for it.  That resolved my problem.Its a good product and service has been good, and overall I am satisfied with it, but its still pretty dang expensive for what it is (hence the 4 stars).

Title: Awesomeness in a small package.
Review Comment: If you are looking to create a home network and get coverage throughout your whole house this is the tool for you. They are literally the size of a small piece of sandwich bread that is overstuffed with fillings. We have had great coverage and increased the ability our internet to handle more devices. Yes we have the almighty (crappy) Spectrum formally time warner cable.

Title: Fantastic
Review Comment: Great product. Exceeded expectations.

Title: Just an Amazing product!
Review Comment: Simply amazing.  Easy to set up.  I did need to hard wire my first two eeros to each other.  Going from the main eero downstairs to the others upstairs rendered a weak signal, but hard wiring it was worth it.  I'm getting over 200mb in my past deads spots, such as the master bed room and deck, which makes this purchase worth the money as it works and communicates with itself to keep working and it did not interfere with my TV downstairs I have hard wired to the xfinity modem.  I read of Issues with LUMA having issues with existing hardwired connecitons.

Title: Best tech purchase ever!
Review Comment: Best tech purchase ever! So easy to use and the tech support was amazing when things were a bit slow after a network update!

Title: Easy, immediate solution to my wifi woes!
Review Comment: After an amazingly simple and Apple-like setup, my wifi issues were solved. No more dropoffs and inconsistent speed. I was finally getting the wifi I was paying for. I'm using a 2 device system in a 1300 square foot home.

Title: Very good system. After years of frustration with wifi coverage ...
Review Comment: Very good system. After years of frustration with wifi coverage in my house Eero has finally solved the problem and I no longer have wifi "dead zones". Extremely easy to install and worked straight out of the box. Highly recommend this product.

Title: eero rocks!
Review Comment: After years of frustration trying to get wifi through out my old three story house, I actually hired an audio guy thinking a professional could finally solve my problem. He was the one who suggested eero. And, he said: "why not install it yourself?" I took the leap and order the three pack that came neatly boxed with easy--very easy--to follow directions. In a matter of minutes after installing the app and plugging in the three units, I was up and running. I haven't looked back since. We have consistent wifi throughout the house.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: like

Title: Finally, Hassle Free WiFI that Simply Works!
Review Comment: I purchased the 3 pack in July 2016 and I've had absolutely no issues with them whatsoever. I cannot say the same for the NETGEAR Nighthawk AC1900 Dual Band Wi-Fi Gigabit Router (R7000) with Open Source Support. Compatible with Amazon Echo/Alexa that I purchased in January 2015 and its companion, the NETGEAR Nighthawk AC1900 Desktop WiFi Range Extender (EX7000-100NAS) purchased in June 2015. At the time, I thought I was out of my mind spending $400 on the eero Home WiFi System (it would've been $500 at the time, but Amazon offered a promo of $100 off), especially considering the amount of money I had already spent on the Netgear Nighthawk equipment. While the Netgear equipment provided fast throughput, I clearly decided 6 mos after purchasing the router that I needed an extender. Also, by 2016 I was experiencing dropouts all the time to the point that I routinely had to cycle the router nearly every day. I could not for the life of me figure out what was going on w/the Netgear router. I was so frustrated that I simply had to try the eero Home WiFi System. To date, I've had no dropouts; no need to cycle power - the eero simply works and is frustration free. I have one in second floor my home office, one in my upstairs bedroom, and the third in a cabinet (supposedly a no-no re: reception) that house my gaming systems, DVR, etc. There are currently 23 connected devices including 2 desktops, 3 laptops, 2 tablets, 3 cell phones, 4 Sonos speakers, 3 streaming devices, 3 Arlo cameras, 1 Ring doorbell camera (which prompted the purchase of the Netgear Extender), multiple Hue lightbulbs, etc. etc. When needed and in use, everything that is on my network works and works well. I never experience buffering issues when streaming music or TV. Web pages load quickly and multiplayer gaming is lag free. I also have a strong signal in my front and back yard! (I'm using this with Comcast Blast Plus!I also like that they are low profile and simply elegant compared to the beastly size and unattractive look of my old Netgear equipment (currently housed in a drawer until I figure out what to do with them). The only draw back I can think of is that there is only one ethernet port. However, that problem is easily solved through the purchase of an ethernet switching device such as the one I purchased for roughly $10: NETGEAR 5-Port Fast Ethernet 10/100Mbps Switch (FS205).  Oh - and I initially had an issue in which I had a problem getting eero to work with my employer's VPN and customer support was quick, friendly and solved the problem. That was the one and only problem I've had with these. All in all, If you're looking for a hassle free solution to router/WiFi issues and you don't mind that you're not going to be able to tweak various settings like QOS, then the eero system is the way to go. Frankly, I don't miss looking at or tweaking the various settings on Netgear's software - I really don't have a need to with the eero since it works as expected. Which is to say that the eero Home Wifi System exceeded my expectations and was definitely worth the expense in order to achieve hassle free WiFi throughout my home (including the yard, attic and basement). Highly, highly recommended.

Title: Very Satisfied.  Easy Set Up.  Works well with Apple Express
Review Comment: I had an existing WiFi with an Apple Time Capsule supplemented by Apple Express's throughout my 2100 square foot, two story house.  The system wasn't working.  Typically, upstairs I was getting speeds in the neighborhood of 3 to 5 mbps.  Not satisfactory to run Airplay well.  So I bought an Eero 3 pack.  Set up was so easy.  Really.  I mean really.  I had trouble getting my Apple Express connected to the Eero system so I could continue to run Airplay.  I got great help from Eero's call center from Nick who talked me through it.  Now my system works seamlessly.  My Apple Express are connected to my Eero Wifi and Apple Airplay works perfectly every time.  Plus I was able to, with Nick's help, connect my Apple Time Capsule to my system so it keeps backing up my system.  The speeds now upstairs consistently run from 25 mbps to 45 mbps.

Title: EERO - it just plain works.
Review Comment: It just works. The highest compliment I can give. My other routers needed intense time to set up and over an hour with customer service to make it work.This is just plug and play and updates itself. I bought five of them. Yes more expensive but well worth the mental health of dealing with routers that are so temperamental. Nice phone people too. I called them with questions before I made my purchase.

Title: eero rocks!
Review Comment: the eero system has transformed internet functionality in our home. I had not known the product until we had another wifi system failure and our tech support man strongly recommended we invest in the 3-pack. It works like a charm, easy installation, impressive connectivity. I recommend the 3-pack system to cover an entire house.  Bravo, eero!

Title: Awesome system
Review Comment: Finally I have wifi in the whole house. Our modem is in the bedroom and there are three walls between there and our den, this system now provides reliable wifi everywhere in the house. Downloads are really fast and we can stream movies with no problems.

Title: eero Mesh Wifi Not Magic - Don't Buy If Existing Wifi Setup Works
Review Comment: I purchased these on the hype to replace a set of 3 Apple Airport Express and 1 Apple Airport Extreme that blanketed my house. I had a few problems with moving to room to room on WiFi with the Apple set-up so was willing to try the mesh wifi world. All 4 of my eero's are connected to a switch at home which is connected to the router - which is the same setup I used with the Apple Airports. The couple of issues I have had are:- eero units randomly flashing red lights and not being available - this could be for a few seconds or longer- not playing well with multiple WeMo devices and switches throughout the house- I have had multiple occasions where the wired Internet speeds are 45 Mbps and the eero speeds are less than 10 Mbps with no activity in the houseOn the plus side - I think the iOS software is nicely done.TL;DR - I bought the hype on these units - but don't think the premium is justified. Stick with your old wifi setup if it works. This will not magically make everything better i.e. unicorns riding on rainbows will not deliver stable and fast Internet speeds to every corner of your house.

Title: Best-of-breed wifi solution. Excellent!
Review Comment: I've tried many different wifi base stations over time. Most of them were somewhere between decent and unusable. Even high-quality vendors, like Apple's Airport, still kicked my devices and my family's off the network or didn't give good coverage throughout the house (which has four floors), thus resulting in poor or no performance in many cases. I have young children who sometimes watch movies on an iPad, so bad connectivity translates directly to an unpleasant day for me. I have to have a solution that works.One idea I had was to put a different wifi router in each part of the house, hardwired via ethernet. The downside with this is if you connect to the one on the top floor with your phone, and then you walk downstairs, your connectivity is bad. So an interesting idea, but not really practical. And don't even start me on extenders. In my experience, they're all terrible, assuming they work at all, which is often not the case.eevo really solves this problem and does a great job. I got the package of three base stations. I have my own internal network and don't want to connect the eevo directly to the Internet, so I set it up in bridged mode and made it serve a range of DHCP IP addresses. (Note: these are advanced settings, but it's nice to know it's possible to do this.) In my case, all three base stations were connected to house ethernet, which probably helps, but this is not technically necessary, according to eevo. (I did not test this, because I'm happy with my current configuration, and I'm sure at any rate that ethernet will be faster..)The three base stations merged seamlessly into a single wifi network, available throughout the house. The network offers very strong signal (all bars) everywhere. It's the same network, so there's no need to connect to a different network in a different part of the house. The speed is excellent, very comparable to the best wifi routers I've used in the past. And neither I, nor my wife and kids, ever get kicked off the network. It's extremely stable.It did take me a while to figure out I really wanted bridged networking. I just needed eevo to give me wifi DHCP access to my own network, nothing fancy beyond that. Also, the eevo documentation insists that you must plug your primary eevo directly into the service provider's modem, bypassing any firewalls etc, but this is not in fact necessary -- or I should say it might be necessary if your firewall is set up in an overly restrictive manner, but it was not a problem for me. (It might well also have been a problem if bridged networking had not been a sufficient solution for me.) I guess the point here is the docs are less than clear about this.Overall, eevo provides exceptional service in signal, in speed, and in stability, far better for a whole-house solution than anything else I've ever tried -- and I've tried many, many different things over the years. It's a clear winner and if your needs and problems match those I described, I strongly recommend that you give eevo a try.

Title: Best Wifi system you'll ever own!!!
Review Comment: Simply amazing!!

Title: Great Sysrem
Review Comment: The system is great.  3200 square ft 2 level house.  Great coverage with fantastic speed.

Title: Eero on Wave Broadband
Review Comment: This is my second time giving eero a try. My first attempts failed on a successful mesh network using AT&T Uverse DSL, I followed the setup process and googled and tried what others suggested. Eero just did not work as advertised on AT&T.Fast forward to 6 months later after being frustrated with AT&T speeds I switched over to Wave Broadband and got the 250 Mbps down and 10 Mbps package. Initially I took there generic cable modem/wifi router. What a disappointment, I had better speeds than with AT&T however I was not getting what I paid for. So I decide to purchase my own cable modem (Arris SB6190 Surfboard) and the eero system again. After a few kinks getting everything setup and the eero updates they system has been working flawlessly. I now have complete mesh wifi coverage at full speeds and more in my entire house. I know the eero system is very pricey however it really works and to me it was worth every penny.Bottom line is eero really works and it works well on Wave Broadband.

Title: EERO SERIOUSLY ROCKS!!
Review Comment: I'm paying a "service provider" a ton of money for "super fast internet". Turns out it's only super fast when you plug in directly to the modem! The wifi upload and download speeds are TERRIBLE! This Eero system now has my wifi functioning at the super speeds I'm actually paying for. EERO is a life saver and is worth every penny!

Title: Super easy set up and it is completely automated
Review Comment: Works just as advertised. Super easy set up and it is completely automated. Absolutely transformed my Wi-Fi space. Have already recommended it to friends and family. Will be purchasing some as gifts.

Title: Glad I made the switch
Review Comment: Easy to set up. Fast downloads and uploads. All of my devices (over 10 of them) have worked flawlessly since I installed eero. would wholeheartedly recommend.

Title: Overall pretty satisfied
Review Comment: Easy to install - I use xfinity triple play. I ended up needing a total of 4 eero's to cover my house and deck; 2 stories, 2500 square feet. I definitely notice better coverage in some areas of the house and there are no longer any dead spots anywhere. But very occasionally my connection will hang and I have to go into airplane mode and back out again to get it to run smoothly. its hard to monitor exactly where the problem is. Overall pretty satisfied though.

Title: Solved our problem.  It's great.
Review Comment: We were having great difficulty getting WiFi throughout our "U" shaped home.  The Eero Home WiFi System solved the problem.  I don't hear the complaint of, "There's no WiFi!" anymore.

Title: Their support was fairly good, but we never could get them to work ...
Review Comment: Man, I really, really wanted these to work. The setup on them was *way* faster than the Linksys Velops. Their range is lower than the Velops, but I was okay with that because all I wanted was consistent, reliable wifi. While they started out slower than the linksys, they were still fast enough for everything we needed. The problem comes that within a week or two the speed drops off to almost nothing. I had my macbook pro literally 2 feet from one of the hardwired base stations. I was getting 2mbps. I restarted the base station (which requires you to unplug/plug it back in). After it came back up, I was getting 180mbps again. Not having to restart the eeros was the only reason I bought them (i.e. rock solid wifi). Their support was fairly good, but we never could get them to work 100%. So, I returned them. At this point, I'm back to using 4 airport extremes (all hardwired) around my house. I haven't had any issues since.

Title: Many cheers for eero!
Review Comment: I'm so happy I could shout.  This is so complete a solution, so simple, so stable, so fast, that wifi problems seem to be a thing of the past.  Setup was a matter of less than 10 minutes for the base unit and less than 5 for each of the other two.  I'm certainly no expert, but I've been setting up and managing my own wifi networks for about 20 years and this is the easiest and most dependable I've ever found.

Title: I have added some more eero for upstairs in my house and again its amazing product. Thoroughly recommend to anyone who currently
Review Comment: After constantly having to reset wifi router, turn off, wait turn back on check do it again or repeat every few days I saw the eero advertised. I read some comments and decided to try it. The Initial problem was having to have a US number. Living in the Middle East this was a slight frustration but emailed eero help and got some tips on what to do. Since installing in Feb-17 I haven't had to reset once! I have added some more eero for upstairs in my house and again its amazing product.Thoroughly recommend to anyone who currently has wifi problems!

Title: You won't regret it.
Review Comment: After trying out about 4 different routers, I am happy to announce that eero solved my wifi issues at my 2 story residence!  I stream a lot of Netflix and Amazon Prime Video and always had buffering issues, but eero changed that!  Couldn't be happier, hopefully this impressive performance continues!

Title: I would buy this again.
Review Comment: This was so super easy to set up.  I wanted three things -- to be able to name my network, set my own password, and have a strong signal.  I got all three so am very happy.  Setup over the app on my phone was very simple.  I thought maybe I'd need some help, but turned out it walks you right through the steps.  Plus, it looks nice -- which is just an added bonus.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Fantastic! WiFi finally solved, reaches everywhere in house with full strength signal! Setup couldn't be simpler. Smartphone app is clean and well designed. Can even turn off the light on the unit in the bedroom so it doesn't shine in your eyes all night.

Title: Delivers as advertised & and responsive customer service!
Review Comment: My long time network configuration - an Apple Time Capsule with Apple Airport Expresses as network extenders finally had to be "retired" because network performance was becoming inconsistent. It served me well for years; however, I could never get a solid wifi signal throughout my home, nor the performance throughput I was paying for with Comcast.Got tired of my wife complaining about as the signal degradation the past year. Watch the Eero video on their web site.....it is spot on. I was doing everything the guy in the video was doing. I purchased Eero's products, because I didn't want to deal with a non-consumer friendly, poorly designed, and less than stellar performance networking solution. I did look at competing mesh networking products, but chose Eero for the favorable customer experience.Set-up was as easy as everyone has written about. Just plug the devices in as instructed, and everything was recognized by their iOS app. Took a few minutes on my devices were all online. I kept my same network name as my old one and the same network password, so all my devices were recognized.Only task I had to do was update the firmware. The firmware update done via their iOS app and the network worked perfectly after upgrade. The only extra thing I did was assign a unique name to every device on my network. I did not care if I didn't have all the configuration parameters like I did with my Apple set-up, because I never used the overly technical settings to begin with.I now have 17 unique devices on the network with no reported problems. This includes one Nest thermostat, three Nest smoke alarms, one Apple time machine network drive, two iPads, two iPhones, one Apple TV, one Amazon Fire stick, one Apple iMac, one Apple MacBook Pro, and a five others for good measure. No lags, no offline conditions, etc. It appears to just work.Observations:- Easy to install and set-up.- Eero constantly improving their software and features. Very easy to see how committed they are to making this a best in class product.- iOS app is straight forward. No bloated app design. They keep it simple and clean. No way to get lost in it.- App allows you to turn off the device indicator light.- Covers my two-story home with consistent high throughput wifi coverage.- Responsive customer service. When one of my devices failed after 48 hrs. I called Eero and got a live person who spoke English...they shipped a replacement device immediately. All I had to do was return the defective device in the package with pre-paid shipping label. Easy.- Easy online Help information. Again, information is easy to find/search for, well composed, and offers easy to follow instructions.- Delivers a consistent and available connection across my 2200 foot two story home. Check out the awesome performance I am getting in the picture I posted.Misc.- One satellite device failed after 48 hrs, but Eero replaced it immediately (thank you Eero).- When checking the wifi performance via the iOS app, it is not clear how the network speed results are determined. It would be nice know which device it is testing the network throughput from. When I test with Speedtest.net, I get a totally different network performance number. I don't know why. Maybe another user can enlighten me. I did notice when I check the network speed on multiple devices with the Eero app....they all activate. Interesting, no issue on that, just my curiosity why?- I wish the devices were smaller in footprint like the Apple Airport Express.No showstoppers, a positive customer experience, and my wife is happy with her husband again.Thank you Eero, keep up the good work!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Excellent product

Title: Super Super easy to install and I had no issue ...
Review Comment: Super Super easy to install and I had no issue doing it myself.  Great signal strength throughout our house now which our kids love.  Best money I have spent on WiFi system in a long time - so easy!!!

Title: Worked as advertised!
Review Comment: This system worked exactly as described! Easy to set up using the app, it reached the areas of my home where the previous router extender I had failed to reach. Definitely worth the investment!

Title: Great Product but not for Rural or if your Internet is not 99.9999% reliable
Review Comment: This product looks great and feels quality.  I think it deserve a 5 but you may not see if without a 1 star.  Here is the issue to be aware of.  This is designed to be always connected to the internet.  It will not be able to operate as a Local Area Network without connecting to the internet.  You may think that is ok but remember things like your wifi printer, or wifi drives, etc... will not operate without wifi.  THIS IS NOT FOR YOU if you live in an area that may not have 99.9999% reliable internet connection such as those with say Satellite internet or rural area which is my circumstance and why I was forced to return it.  I spoke to their support who were very helpful and we could not figure a way around this issue.  Their decision for this is to ensure high security which is important in a high population area which is their current market focus.

Title: unreliable
Review Comment: Both Macbook Pro and Dell XPS 13 sometimes lose internet connection, but Eero health check for that device says everything is fine.That seems to happen when connected to an extension Eero. How could I avoid connection to extension Eero if not necessary?

Title: It works!
Review Comment: Yup this sucker really works!  Thank god.  : )

Title: Great product
Review Comment: Fast with no dead spots. Make sure you switch your devices over to it after set up. It's easy to forget as your devices will continue to connect to the previous wifi connection if it is still active.

Title: Best WiFi I have ever owned!
Review Comment: My house was built in 1969.  It is a double split-level and has steel beams in between the floors.  It has been near impossible to get acceptable WiFi in my house since we moved here in 2003.  I have spent hundreds, maybe thousands of dollars in attempts to get WiFi to cover most most of my house.  Multiple zones and APs.  Powered antennas.  WiFi boosters.  Nothing worked well.  I have been using ethernet over power adapters up until now because of this.  I had attempted to use mesh routers in the past, but they were enterprise class and too expensive or hard to manage.  So eero has been a breath of fresh air.  They have been exactly as they were described.  I love the fact that there is no manual.  Just download the app and go.  I plugged the first into my gigabit router, worked as expected.  The next one I was expecting issues.  I have had so many problem going from the office to the living room.  Number 2, no issue.  Wow!  Ok, number 3 in the upstairs solarium.  No issue.  I could not believe it.  There are no more dead spaces in my house.  No more putting my phone outside the kitchen to play streaming music because I couldn't get coverage.  Before eero I had also recently moved to gigabit ethernet for my internet service and was so disappointed that I was getting a fraction of the speed to my devices.  It seemed like a complete waste.  Now I am getting optimal speeds for the wireless technology and actually seeing the difference in having gigabit.  I've already recommended to a friend and he bought there right then and there based on my testimony alone.  I can easily say, these are the best WiFi routers I have ever owned and I no longer worry about if my WiFi is working.  Thanks eero!

Title: Easy to install
Review Comment: Sleek packaging, super easy to install, but main unit burnt out after only first 5 hours, rendering the entire 3 unit system useless. With technology as critical as this, the poor quality makes me very leery of relying on it to control every IoT device (internet access, HD cameras, security devices, etc,) in my home. I need bullet-proof reliability and my initial experience with Eero is simply not it. Had to revert back to my Netgear router which fortunately I kept. Although, customer support was very helpful in getting me back online using another Eero puck, until I see how the system performs over the long haul, I would be hard pressed to recommend this product at this time.

Title: Almost Gigabit Internet Ready
Review Comment: In my quest to find the MESH WIFI system that could handle the Gigabit Internet, eero did well. The setup was easy and the packaging was great, but it did not score on the speed the same ways as Google Wifi. eero produce about 500 Mbps on average when connected via ethernet, vs Google Wifi at 650. If you are looking to have the smallest profile WIFI this is a great choice.

Title: Well worth the price.
Review Comment: Truly impressed by this device. Love the mobile app as well

Title: It's quite amazing. I get that this is not highly customizable
Review Comment: I was skeptical until I tried, but it did make a noticeable difference. It's quite amazing. I get that this is not highly customizable, but if you want something easy and don't want to bother with advanced configuration, this is worth the money.

Title: Love this system
Review Comment: Love this system!!... It was very easy to set up and has dramatically improved my internet speed and ZERO dead spots in my 2400 sq ft 2 story house. I had some issues with getting access via my desktop PC to a DVR on my network and EERO customer service was fantastic to get it all sorted out. I highly recommend this system

Title: Useless.
Review Comment: We have concrete walls and it would not broadcast to the next room.  We have a TP Link router that works three rooms over.  Useless.

Username: Heaven Bound Thanks to Jesus Christ
Title: Excellent
Review Comment: Love these as they give our complete home wifi, no dead spots. I have the 3 pack plus one for a total of four.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: easy to set up. best wifi I have ever used

Title: Awesome!
Review Comment: A mesh network that simply works! Easy setup no issues.

Title: Fire hazard does not work and no returns after it broke 4 months in. Support won't help
Review Comment: Beware. Do not buy this POS.  But the Google system. This is a crime eero and Amazon can sell this garbage. The product and support suck. This box is not working and it is as hot as an oven.  Amazon says no returns.  This is a racket. Fix or replace this piece  of garbage. It seems to be a fire hazard in my book and certainly is not a wifi router. What are my next steps to get this solved. You ant take 500 bucks and get away with 4.5 months of a working product.

Title: Get eero awesome product
Review Comment: I never write reviews but this product is awesome. I wasted countless hours over the last three years in my 2700 sq ft one floor condo w brick walls trying to get wifi in the dead areas. Nothing worked.  Took eero out of the box and in 45 minutes, great wifi everywhere. I am so fired up im waiting for the shoe to drop... super easy app, super easy to set up.... i also spent hours cross referencing reviews of other home wifi systems.before i bought eero...eero is the one to get.....awesome

Title: Excellent solution to home wireless network problems
Review Comment: Internet connectivity and wireless network performance was a chronic problem in my house.  This was the solution.  It was simple to set up and provides trouble free connectivity.  I use one unit per floor in a three story house with a mix of wired and wireless connections.  Performance and reliability are excellent. Units self configure to support wired connections.Only issue I had was with overheating.  I have not seen a unit overheat if located out in the open.  However if you want to locate them in a cabinet you will need to take measures to avoid overheating.  I put rubber feet on the units to increase ground clearance and drilled some discreet ventilation holes in the cabinet. Note that the overheated unit stopped working but did not appear to suffer any permanent damage.  Simply unplugging the unit, allowing it to cool off, and then plugging it back in restored normal operation.

Title: Outstanding System.
Review Comment: Simply cannot believe how wonderful the eero Home Wifi System is.  We were stressed with our new Apple wifi because we had dead spots.  Turns out we needed a system like eero and now we exceptional wifi throughout our home and patio areas.

Title: Will be a 5 STAR purchase once price drops to $300
Review Comment: We received RAVED REVIEWS abt the EERO HOME WIFI SYSTEM which inspired me to make this purchased.  Came highly recommended.  After delivery + installation I must wholeheartedly agree!  Vastly improved stable connectivity and the quality.  Radically improved our net experience from working, surfing to streaming!!!  The only downside was the price ... nearly $500.  Work from home folks MUST HAVE RELIABLE CONNECTIVITY meaning this is not a luxury purchase but its essential.  Will be a 5 STAR purchase once price drops to $300.  BELOW AVERAGE VALUE.

Title: Four Stars
Review Comment: As advertised. Seems to give less quality signal than my previous access point (Apple Airport Extreme)

Title: Great system that works
Review Comment: Great system and super easy to setup. I purchased an additional eero to bring it to 4 for my system (2 wired, 2 wirless). The easy assignment of devices to profiles allows me to easily put a halt on my kids surfing when chores and such are not started/completed.The only thing I think needs improving is the built in speed test does not seem accurate, using the Ookla app seems to show a more accurate depiction of the download speed.

Title: Doesn't work in Brownstone. Get Linksys Velop
Review Comment: I had to return it because it didn't work in my 4 story brownstone. In fact it barely worked when trying to connect on the same floor. I ended up going with the Linksys Velop Tri-band AC6600 and love it.

Title: Nice design, but loss of speed wasn't worth it
Review Comment: Love the design and easy setup, but I took a big bandwidth drop compared to my existing router.  I tried lots of locations to make sure it was optimally setup, but bottom line is that I was getting a lot less than my normal speed so I returned it.

Title: Two Stars
Review Comment: For the money, it hasn't proved itself worthy

Title: Not bad, but expensive.
Review Comment: These devices are pretty good. While it's definitely an upgrade over trying to use a single cable-company-provided router to provide wifi throughout my 3,500 sq foot house, it's not perfect. In my experience, you have to put these things pretty close to one another. As such, I had to buy four of them. So, sure, it works, but it has now cost about $600. Hardly a value.

Title: Why didn't I buy this sooner!
Review Comment: Pretty amazinggg! I was skeptical at first, but then I saw my speed go from 30mbps to 102mbps. I live in a 3 level brick rowhouse and had to deal with constant wifi dead spots in around my house (especially on the third floor). Eero has changed my life.

Title: Spouse and Kids Complaining About Your Home Wifi -  Buy This !
Review Comment: If your family complains / does not understand how to switch between the several access points and extenders you have lovingly set up in your house, then the EERO is for you!  If your teenagers are running up your data plan on their devices because the internet in your house is "too slow" or "doesn't work",  then the EERO is for you too!  This is an awesome product that solved those problems for me.  I had one question during setup about how to change the default IP range (so that existing devices on my network with static IP addresses did not have to be reconfigured).  My call to tech support was answered by a knowledgeable onshore respresentative, on a SATURDAY.

Title: Awesome Product
Review Comment: I have had to buy several other wifi routers in the past because they just seem to not work for very long. A friend told me about eero so I decided to do some research. Well after doing the research I finally purchased this product and I can't be happier. I work with wireless networks on a daily basis and I must say this has got to be the best home wifi system out there hands down. Everything connects and stays connected. I would recommend any one to buy this product. I know it is a little pricey for some but it is well worth the cost.

Title: Fios? Not completely
Review Comment: In concept they are fantastic. However they do not work as advertised with all features for FIOS

Title: Great purchase, Highly recommend
Review Comment: This is simply an exceptional product.  In summary, it was relatively easy to set up and provides strong, fast coverage across my home.  Prior to installing, download the app and set your phone to cellular with bluetooth on (turn off wifi on your phone).  Follow directions setting up the base device (I believe they are exactly the same but I will refer to the 1st device as the base).  You might want to conduct a software update at this time but I'm not sure it really matters.  Let the app lead you thru the set up of your satellite devices which should be line of sight and 40 feet or so away.  I did run into problems with the second phase as I was experiencing a bluetooth glitch.  I eventually called tech support which was fantastic!  They quickly answered and solved the issue.  The completion of the set up was a breeze from that point on.  I was told that this wasn't a common issue but its nice to know that the support line was this good.  I was working off of an Apple time capsule prior to installing the Eero device and it lost coverage and speed across the my house.  The difference is simply striking!  I could average 5 - 20 Mbs download depending upon the room I was in except for the extreme points in the house where is was a crap shot as to signal.  Now my coverage is 25 - 40 Mbs in the far reaches of my home.  Note: the Eero app seems to test your potential speed not the actual speed (it seems to regularly give 60Mbs as metric).  So I was using another speed test.  Again, simply a fantastic purchase and I am very happy with it across the board

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Great product. No more wifi problems

Title: Satisfied old couple
Review Comment: We got the eero system after many frustrating years of buying worthless routers and range extenders. We tried routers at both ends of our large, one level house to no avail. Our house had been pre-wired for Dial Up in the nineties, which we found out to be obsolete and an expert told us about the mesh system and we installed a new direct line to the Frontier modem and from there after bridging the router via an gigabit switch to the new eero system.We are very satisfied with the results as we are using lots of computers and TVs throughout the house. Since the system has been installed there was no need for re setting the modem/router anymore. We are thinking to get a fourth eero to better cover the guest area at the far end of the house.

Title: Worthy product that really works!
Review Comment: Prior to purchasing the Eero, I was consistently having issues with slow internet, lagging and constant buffering of programs I was streaming. I had an extender, which was hit or miss. A friend recommended I try the Eero. I purchased the 2 pack for my 2045 square foot, one level home. It was a bit pricey, but it's the worth cost to avoid the frustration of interrupted internet service. Regardless of where I am in my home, I always have a strong signal. I would definitely recommend this product and the set-up was a snap!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Huge improvement in my home for wifi!

Title: Works great. 3 of them was enough to reach the ...
Review Comment: Works great. 3 of them was enough to reach the wifi into parts of our home that it used to be impossible.

Title: Great System
Review Comment: While this system is not cheap, it was worth every penny to me. The wi-fi coverage in our house is so much better than it was with our previous system. Also, the setup app on my iPhone made every step so easy to complete especially since I am too old to be a techspert.

Title: Works great, costs a lot.
Review Comment: Works great.  Easy to set up.  Small units.  Pleasing to the eye.  EXPENSIVE

Title: Expensive But Worth Every Penny.
Review Comment: I have used EVERY wifi system imaginable. Nothing has ever worked as well as Eero in my house. Even when I bought extra routers to increase the coverage signals were spotty and variable, no matter where I positioned them. With Eero I bought three units and have never looked back!  How good are they? My family runs three DVRs, and a wifi- capable TV, three laptops and various tablets in my house. Even with all of that the speed is consistently high in all my locations.They were the easiest to install networks as well. The app made the installation basically plug and play.Visually they are unobtrusive and elegant.  No boxes looking contraptions with antennae sticking out.  People don't notice them although one of them sits on a low book shelf in my family room.About the only complaint I have is that they are Expensive. But having bought expensive and cheap systems before I deem Eero worth every penny I paid for it. My wife consults from home so having reliable hi-speed wifi helps maintain 'domestic tranquility.'

Title: love these things
Review Comment: best purchase ever

Title: Product issues and dubious company policies
Review Comment: I hate to have to write this review as I really wanted these Eero's to work. However, as it turns out, my old apple airports never had the issues I experienced until I switched over to Eero. Once I switched back to the old airports, all the following issues went away.Frequent DropsAs seen in the attached video, you'll notice that the throughput goes up and down every 30-45 seconds, which is significant enough that it causes streaming music to pause frequently. Of course streaming video was a non-starter. I spent over a month trying to debug this with Eero support with no luck. Note that this issue happens no matter the distance to the access point.ConnectivityMost of my devices connect fine. However, I have a couple of devices that seem to have connectivity problems on a regular bases. One of my MacBook Pro's required me to hard code an IP in order to maintain a connection. Same issue was found with an iPad as well. Note that this issue happens no matter the distance to the access point.CompanyIt's also important to note that I tried to work with the company to resolve these issues for a couple of months. I started the process with Eero Support within the first month, creating videos and providing long detailed explanations regarding the behaviors. They logged into my devices remotely to monitor the behavior and also sent me a custom firmware.  However, now that it seems like they won't be able to fix the issues, I asked for a refund. However, eero refused because they said it was over a month since I purchased the product. I explained that this hardly seemed fair given I, in good faith, worked with their support organization to resolve their product issues, conversations which started BEFORE the month mark. I would recommend folks thinking about purchasing an eero make sure you quickly confirm the performance of the product and return the product right away if any issues are all are found instead of working with Support given this policy.

Title: Setup was easy even for someone that doesn't have a clue about ...
Review Comment: Setup was easy even for someone that doesn't have a clue about networks!I installed it with my Xfinity/Modem router and I had to do was plug it in the back and follow the directions.Thank you eero!

Title: Easy set up, perfect coverage. Recommend!
Review Comment: Setup was ridiculously simple, and we have had perfect, uninterrupted, full bar WiFi coverage everywhere in our 2 story house from the moment we set up the Eero system. We have one unit upstairs and one downstairs. Definitely worth the money!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Love it love it love it!!!

Title: 6ft distance = poor connection
Review Comment: Worst wifi product EVER! They would not connect to each other even though the devices were 6 feet from each other with 1 wall seperating. Can't believe how bad this product is.  Pathetic excuse!!

Title: One Star
Review Comment: Doesn't work for macbook pro, air...

Title: These are amazing. I have an old brick house and multiple ...
Review Comment: These are amazing. I have an old brick house and multiple nest cameras and wifi devices.  I was using an archer c7 before this and could never get devices working consistently.  Eero has worked flawlessly from day 1. No dropped video anymore and wifi reaches everywhere with a decent signal.

Title: Expensive... but works really well. Large ...
Review Comment: Expensive...but works really well. Large, old house with thick walls. Waiting for sale to get two more.

Title: Pricey but terrific.
Review Comment: Bit the bullet after a disasterous experience with Arris rip-current devices (which were an epic fail). Eero is pricey but works well right out the box. Installation is a breeze and frequent software updates continue to improve performance. I've got great wifi coverage throughout my house and lots of data on it.

Title: Easy as 1, 2, 3 to set up.
Review Comment: They were very easy to set up and they work great.

Title: NAT LOOPBACK is not available.  Doesn't switch well for iOS devicesm. Customer service is indifferent
Review Comment: Do you need NAT loopback?  If you don't know the answer to this then Eero might be ok for you (keep reading), but if you understand networking then don't.  Just don't buy this.  And if you have Apple devices, then REALLY dont buy this.  They don't seamlessly switch from device to device as advertised.  Save some money and buy the Google system instead.

Title: Best WiFi setup and coverage I have ever had
Review Comment: Best WiFi setup and coverage I have ever had, and I have been trying different products & configurations each year. Goodbye Apple!

Title: Really changed bandwith and coverage throughout our two story brick ...
Review Comment: Really changed bandwith and coverage throughout our two story brick home. Now we get near line (100Mbps) speed in all areas of our home including basement. I did run CAT6 cable to each access point but wow what a difference. Also the app to manage eero is great

Title: Excellent signal strength; Idiot-Proof Installation
Review Comment: We had an older WiFi with an extender that gave us constant headaches -- we often had to unplug the units several times a day and signal strength was uneven throughout our large house. After doing research on the eero vs. Google's unit, we decided on the eero not only because of the good reviews (in Amazon and in the technical press) but also because Google requires you to make the unit part of the ever-creeping Google ecosystem that watches everything you do in searches, emails, and the like, and adds it to the profile it keeps for you in order to sell ads more targeted to how they have you categorized. I would rather have my WiFi system just do its work without whispering about me to Google in the background!The system is dead easy to set up -- literally, we just plugged and played, following the directions in the app. It worked right out of the box. Since installing eero, we have had flawless service - no interruptions and signal strength throughout the house is high.The design of the units is sleek and unobtrusive. Although we didn't need to ask for help, apparently the support offered is excellent.This works as well as any modern internet product we have put into service in recent years. Completely satisfied; would recommend and buy again if need arose.

Title: Still needs improvement
Review Comment: When it works it works well. But it will drop the connection from the closest unit and connect to the farther one. To correct you have to power cycle everything.

Title: Happy
Review Comment: It wasn't as easy as it was like the reviews I've read. Took some time to connect one eero to the other. Our condo has lots of corners and walls but in the end it worked. Phew. Speed did get better and I can run a test on the app. 😊

Title: Fantastic. Have been using Eero now for 3 months
Review Comment: Fantastic.  Have been using Eero now for 3 months.  It NEVER drops.  Internet coverage is strong throughout our large family home and speeds are 70 mbps with 15-20 devices connected.  Very pleased with this purchase.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works great for three floor house!

Title: eero Works!
Review Comment: The eero was my third and last try to extend wifi signal to my home-office.  Comcast router provides 150 Mbps signal, which to my computer degraded to 20, because of distance and concrete walls.  Add a high power/cost range extender and my speed went down to 4.SOLUTION: Plug in one eero to the router and 2 around the home and my speed is up to 65 Mbps, without any fine tuning.  I'd say that works!

Title: Wonderful
Review Comment: We have tried various router and extenders and none have really worked.  We have 3 Eero's and now can use all devices anywhere in the house and patios.  What a wonderful change.

Title: The EERO does not work well in Static IP WAN ...
Review Comment: The EERO does not work well in Static IP WAN mode.  Be aware. I've been using the EERO for over 10 months and then switch to a Static IP setup with my ISP.  I have 20+ devices on my network and for some reason the EERO does not want to allow outbound connection originating from my Honeywell Thermostat.Calls to Support at EERO has been extremely frustrating because the Support at EERO is not well support by EERO's engineering team. The typical response from Support is to try things that are not relevant to the problem, thereby wasting time, hoping that the problem will resolve itself. Or the clients just goes away.EERO Support is based in Austin Texas, and corporate EERO is in San Francisco.  So communication between both organization is weak.  Be prepare to still have trouble shoot you own WIFI problems.My solution is to dump the EERO and go back to purchasing a cheap WIFI router every year.  The EERO system did not last for more than 1 year.

Title: Works Great
Review Comment: I only have one eero but it works great,allways a  strong connection to the WIFI.Recommend you try one or three depends on the way your home or apartment is made,or if their's hard to reach areas. Quality product.

Title: It just works.
Review Comment: This just works. We have a 4 bedroom home and we always had wireless issue, constant drop out and video streaming issues. Since we plug this in 2 months ago, all that disappeared and we've never had to even check on the status of the devices. It just works.

Title: works great. solves a problem
Review Comment: works great.  solves a problem.

Title: It Works!
Review Comment: Without going into much detail, my eero simply works and works very well.  I've had issues with connectivity on my second floor and I set up 2 eeros in my home and it works flawlessly.

Title: Simple and powerful
Review Comment: This product works great.  I've had it for a couple of weeks now and can say it provides the best wifi coverage i've experience.  The setup is about as brain-dead simple as it can get.

Title: Best Wifi I have ever experienced.
Review Comment: I've been a computer user since 1983 and this product is by far the best wifi investment I have ever made.  No dead spots is absolutely accurate.  Seamless connections while moving around the house is wonderful.  Home security camera feeds no longer stall due to buffering. Setup was amazingly fast and simple with the iPhone app.  All three nodes were up and running flawlessly in just a few minutes.  I highly recommend the eero Home Wifi System.

Title: AWESOME. I hope they never change their tech support
Review Comment: There have been a couple of instances of needing tech support due to some update, whether from EERO or my computer or the device.  I called EEROs help line, got help within 1 minute, and got the problems solved each time within 15 minutes!  AWESOME.  I hope they never change their tech support.

Title: I'd recommend to do some initial placement testing because it makes ...
Review Comment: It's an expensive but very functional mesh solution. It improved signal in the farthest room from the modem from around 2Mbit to 70Mbit (I have a 100Mbit connection). I'd recommend to do some initial placement testing because it makes a huge difference. In my case I was placing the last unit inside the room with my desktop and it turned out the unit was too far from the closest one. I got much better results placing the unit in an adjacent room.

Title: Easy to set up and so far
Review Comment: it actually works as described. Easy  to set up and so far, no issues and super fast internet speed.

Title: Fantastic and easy product with a few opportunities for improvement
Review Comment: Great replacement for my Apple AirportExtreme.  Family "profiles" make it easy to manage devices.  Easy to setup and get running ... as long as you have an iPhone or android device.What I wish:- I wish there was access to any sort of bandwidth prioritization control.- I really wish there was a "default" profile to ensure all unrecognized devices get no access.- I wish there was an admin application that didn't require a smart phone.  Why not include either web (ideally) or mac/windows versions?

Title: FANTASTIC SOLUTION. WORTH EVERY PENNY.
Review Comment: Eero is simply amazing. I have struggled for over three years looking for a whole house wifi solution without success. After spending considerable $$ on different routers and boosters/extenders, I purchased and installed eero. The network has had 100% reliability for months now with strong coverage throughout the house and even in areas that before had no signal. I give eero the highest recommendation possible!!

Title: This is a good router for people who really have no concept of ...
Review Comment: I was initially impressed with this router but then...The big BUT:If your internet connection goes down the router shuts off your wifi!I called customer service and they said "yes, it is supposed because there is nothing for the untit to do..."  WHAT?!?It took 5 minutes for me to explain the concept of there are things on the local network that are used with or without internet connection.Need to print to your wifi connected printer but your cable modem is down.Nope, go pay a print shop!Need to transfer a file from one home computer to another?Not gonna happen...Want to control you wifi connected home automation lights/devices?Forget it!I've read forums and posted... I was told it only drops wifi if you power cycle it during an outage...  But that's. it quite true because I can see it drop wifi after a few hours of internet outage and checking uptime on my computers verify the power didn't flicker...There was a post from someone who seems to be a developer stating hey know this issue exists and want to fix it but they had bigger things to fix first yet that was an old post and the issue remains...This is a good router for people who really have no concept of a LAN (WiFi) <> WAN (internet) but anyone who has a bit of network knowledge should stay away!Sadly I realized this flaw 4 days after it was too late to return the item and get a better product :-(Be wary...

Title: Amazing
Review Comment: I'm a techie, and am used to having to tinker with stuff to get it working just right. With the eeros, everything just worked. I have had 0 problems, and cannot find any place in my ~3000sqft house where I don't have excellent coverage. I have never seen the wifi symbol on my iPhone drop from full bars.You can hang out on the eero Reddit forums to see technical staff answer all sorts of questions from users, showing the world what their secret sauce is to their technology. They seem really dedicated to their customers.I replaced 2 Apple Time Capsules with a 3 pack. I get my FIOS 100/100 plan almost everywhere I go in the house (and atleast 50/50 in the spots furthest from an eero node). I have had 0 complaints from anyone in my family since setting this up (including the wife!).

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Very easy to install, very easy to use. Great coverage. Worth the cost.

Title: Worth the high cost.
Review Comment: This wifi system actually works! Expensive but worth it. Fairly easy to install.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Very good system

Title: UNRELIABLE PIECES OF JUNK
Review Comment: Took almost a day to bring up because the firmware as shipped was too old to support the features I needed (static iP).  Very tedious and inane setup.To much reliance on the "cloud."  These things become $500 paperweights 45 seconds after the Internet becomes unavailable.  This means you loose all access to any LOCAL stuff you have on your network (printers, networked storage, etc...).  EERO support claims it will stay up as long as you don't reboot, but I've found that doesn't seem to be at all true.  And of course, you can't do anything, even check on the status if they are showing the red light.  This is the WRONG WAY to design these things.

Title: Finally, I don't have to think about routers anymore.
Review Comment: It solved so many wireless issues in our apartment.  It's now way more than I need in my house, but the coverage is excellent and rarely, rarely have an issue.  I don't notice any latency when gaming as well.I love the iOS app that allows me to see what's going on with my network.  eero seems to care what I think as well, they send me the occasional surveys to see what I think.  Keep it up!

Title: Could not be happier!
Review Comment: Honestly...??  BUY IT NOW... FIXED ALL WIFI ISSUES IN MY HOUSE. Teamed it up with 300 speed internet for seamless everything... Could not be happier!

Title: No complaints and great wifi
Review Comment: These are easy to setup and flood my large house with wifi at high throughput.  Better than I expected.  they are expensive and from what I can tell, the Orbi is an equally good chose based on the situation.

Title: Best invention yet for whole house wifi !!
Review Comment: These are the best things ever!! After trying to use wifi extenders and other routers, I got tired of having to change to different wifi names and passwords every time I moved to different parts of the house. With these, I can stay on the same one no matter where I go in the house. I absolutely love these!!

Title: Extremely easy to setup and work great - Could be more configuable
Review Comment: These are incredibly easy to set up, in fact, it took me less than 10 minutes.  I have each of them connected to the backbone using Netgear PLP1200 Powerline adapters, so the communication between units is very fast.  I get full upload/download speed via my ISP and extremely fast communication between computers inside my home.Unfortunately, I did run into a limitation.  I like to use a non-standard network range inside my house.  This way, when I travel with my laptop, the hotel will not assign me an IP address from that range, so the personal firewall will not think it is on my home network.  The eero configuration will only let me choose addresses from RFC 1918 (10.0.0.0, 172.16.0.0 or 192.168.0.0).  I prefer to use 6.6.6.0 /24 since I figure no hotel would ever assign me an IP from that range.  I have done this for years using various routers, but the DHCP settings of the eero just will not allow it.

Title: Spent $400 on this and it does NOT make a ...
Review Comment: Spent $400 on this and it does NOT make a difference in our wifi speeds.  Wish I hadn't been so busy that I missed the return window.

Title: Great product.
Review Comment: We had many dead spots in our home and some of the rooms on the upper floors were dead zones as well. The cellular usage was very high as a result of the kids using their phones with out WIFI. The eero system eliminated the dead zones and the entire house is now covered by wifi.Great product.

Title: Awesome WiFi throughout the whole house
Review Comment: Wow. Totally lived up to the hype.  Super easy install, great app, awesome coverage (house is 2500sq'), continuously strong speeds.  I've been a loyal fan of another company's products (starts with N, ends in Gear) forever and liked their latest Router, but Eero is the way to go.

Title: This made an amazing difference on the wifi all over my house
Review Comment: This made an amazing difference on the wifi all over my house.  In my bedroom I went from 12 Mbps to 100 Mbps speed (my ISPs max), and the connection is a lot more stable and reliable as well.  I'm currently writing this review from my backyard, something which wasn't close to possible with my old router (a two year old netgear).  Setup process was extremely easy as well.  This is a lot more than just extending the wifi's range, it's a whole different level of speed and reliability.

Title: Wi-Fi Coverage as it Should Be
Review Comment: Eero works perfectly in our home. We bought the 3 pack and it covers our entire home - main floor, upstairs and porch area with excellent download and upload speeds. Eero has been a tremendous improvement over our previous set up. Movies, games, everything we do is faster and reliable. Love it. Worth the price.

Title: I really wanted to like this!! BUT
Review Comment: If you have an HP printer the router will kick it off daily. The tech support gurus(4 of them and 3 weeks of headache) cannot figure out why. It is expensive. It does work as long as you have a different printer than HP. I cannot deal with every morning manually re-connecting with the network.

Title: Not as described
Review Comment: Not as advertised. You cannot control website allowed to visit.  And it keep disconnecting

Title: Great Item!
Review Comment: Awesome coverage

Title: Super simple to set up and aesthetically pleasing
Review Comment: Extremely fast and reliable. Super simple to set up and aesthetically pleasing. With my old Linksys router, I hovered around 14-19 Mbps (Wireless) and between 30-40 Mbps via ethernet.Now I'm hovering between 130-140 Mbps WIRELESS :) I haven't tried it via ethernet because I don't need to :) worth every penny, thank you Eero!

Title: Idiot proof. Take it from me!
Review Comment: Pricey but really works as promised & incredibly easy to set up. Has greatly helped the performance of my tv & Ring home security camera system.

Title: Struggling with WiFi Issues, Eero Save the Day!
Review Comment: I've been struggling with WiFi issues for many years. Living in a condo and needed some specific network settings I had very limited options. When I heard I can continue to use my router and add WiFi in bridge mode with the eero I knew I had to give it a try. Not only was it easy to setup, but it worked just as expected. Actually better than expected. I like not having to mess with different frequencies and love the app with the daily speed test. I'm justing using one unit as I have a small place, but it's totally worth the investment and I love that I have the ability to expand if I need to.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Excellent reception throughout a large two story house.Very easy to set up and install.Highly recommended.

Title: Great for our office!
Review Comment: Purchased for our non-profit offices. Set up was incredibly easy and the coverage is terrific . We love not having to worry about switching to a different network in each space.

Title: Super easy to install (minutes
Review Comment: Previously using 2 Apple Extremes in large home.  Installed the pack of 3 eero's and no more complaints from the family.  No more dropped signals and complete coverage...Super easy to install (minutes, literally).  Love them because I don't have to think about them!

Title: the system works like a charm
Review Comment: First, the system works like a charm, every device that I was experiencing problems with from time to time have consistently worked fine since we installed the units about 6 weeks ago. Second and most important it was really easy to install, the app is great and the process is really simple.

Title: Not working well with Sonos: my Sonos speakers first ...
Review Comment: Not working well with Sonos: my Sonos speakers first showed up, then disappeared one by one. Power cycling would bring them back. I went through the Sonos steps of reinstalling the network (connect one of the Sonos speakers via wired Ethernet to the router etc.). This brought Sonos back for a bit until the speakers started disappearing again. A bit more searching on Google confirms that some other people have the problem too and solve it by tinkering with Sonos channel settings but at this point I couldn't be bothered anymore.

Title: Drop of the internet signal is frequent and very annoying!
Review Comment: Unfortunately this system did not work for me and had to return it after 1 week.The speed maybe improved a little but theconstant drop of the signal was a nightmare.

Title: I Highly recommend it
Review Comment: Set up was simple and only took about 7 minutes. Another 4 minutes for the update to v2.2.0-2478. Speed test was very similar to apples extreme.  I have a small apartment and of course I only use one. From time to time this unit is about 20 bucks off the normal price of 199.00.  Yes, it is expensive, but I'm happy for the small unit and all the updates I will be getting in the future.Edite.  Few weeks now with this unit and I can say that One thing, after one day of usage, that was annoying to me, is that I had to restart the unit all over again for some on unknown reason  using my phone number to log on, and they in return sent me a passcode to get back up and running again.  Will update this again later.Edit:  All is well, my mistake in not verifying my account first. Had to do this in order for the system to work as advertised.

Title: Disconnects - not reliable
Review Comment: Very easy to set up but third eero dropped connection after a couple of weeks and support online does not help. No I didn't build a new wall or move furniture!  I even moved it within 15 feet of second and still no dice.  At these prices, these things better work!  I will return and try another product.

Title: This is only the second time a piece of networking ...
Review Comment: This is only the second time a piece of networking equipment has worked right out of the box without fiddly configuration (the first was a Peplink Balance 20). Plugged it in, connected it to our router, downloaded the phone app, entered a name for the wireless network and a password, done. It just worked!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Eero makes wireless networks for your home trivial.

Title: I am extremely pleased with EERO
Review Comment: After spending  lots of money  what other gadgets without success, I am  extremely pleased with EERO. Highly recommended

Title: With the money
