Review Comment: Overall a much better home wifi system than the one it replaced. There is occasional slowness with connectivity but that's minor. The complaining in my house about wifi has ended!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Very good exelent......

Title: Solved My Problem
Review Comment: Very easy to install and works as advertised.  Very expensive, but it does what it says and increased out speed to what we have been paying for.

Title: One Star
Review Comment: 1 of 3 of my eero's stopped working today, after I spent ~$500 for a 3pack from Amazon.

Title: eero - Great product
Review Comment: The Eero nodes were easy to setup and have the flexibility to easily supply DHCP reservations and ports needed for my NAS.  The coverage in my 5700sqft home is great both indoors and outdoors in the garage and patio spaces.  I've seen great throughput from wifi connected devices to my internet modem & NAS wired to a gigabit switch with the base Eero unit.  I am very satisfied with the results although I could wish for a little lower price point.Thanks, Bill

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Easy setup- so far very impressed with this wifi system. The dead zones have disappeared.

Title: The Linksys Velop has been amazing!
Review Comment: Maybe I just didn't give this system a chance. Too many problems and slow wifi. The Linksys Velop has been amazing!

Title: Easy to install
Review Comment: Easy to install. Bought the 3 pack. Was up an running in minutes.I was never able to stream video in most of my 2-story house. Now I can stream everywhere, including the basement and patio.I was paying for internet that I could not use. What a waste. This is a small price to pay.

Title: If you're undecided, let this review help...
Review Comment: I've had this system for 4 weeks now and have been nothing but impressed with its performance. Before eero, I had major issues with spotty coverage in my house...not the case anymore! This was a major financial purchase for us, but has been worth the money so far...

Title: Fantastic wifi system... even if you live outside US
Review Comment: I'm using this outside US, so with a little risk of not having direct support or warranty... but it's still worth the trouble. This product is A+, very stable and reliable. The signal and range are fantastic. And I can move through my house without losing connection or experiencing hiccups. I'm even getting a greater stability over wifi than with ethernet on my previous router. It's THAT good. I can't recommend this enough.

Title: Great For Small Offices Too!
Review Comment: Incredible product.  We're a small company of 40 individuals and, like some of you, we've had issues covering our offices with reliable wifi.  Over the years we've experimented with different consumer-grade access points (Linksys, Asus, TP-Link, etc) and always had the same issue.  If you sat close to the AP you had excellent service.  As soon as you got a good 20-30 feet from the unit it all went downhill.  We're in a highly congested building in NYC so there's a ton of channel contention.  We considered business-class mesh hardware/software from all of the major manufacturers; Ubiquity, Ruckus, etc.  Unfortunately the pricing and learning curve was going to be substantially more than we were willing to invest.  After much debate we decided to buy six eero units and place them throughout the office in bridge mode.  We couldn't be happier!!!  Setup was unbelievably easy and the system is very reliable.  We regularly have anywhere between 50 to 70 devices (combination of Nest cameras, tablets, phones, and laptops) connected to the system and performance/throughput is solid.We get it, these aren't necessarily meant for business use but quite honestly, if you're a small business and don't want to hire an engineer to install and maintain expensive hardware this may work for you.

Title: Excellent performance, easy set up.
Review Comment: So easy to set up,replaced AirPort Extreme with this system. Very easy, 3 story Victorian (basement garage, living room& kitchen, upstairs library & bedrooms) . Old system was AirPort Extreme, iTV connected by Ethernet, upstairs connected by Ethernet and airport- now just 3 eero units. And faster speeds!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works well where other routers / boosters has failed.

Title: easy to configure
Review Comment: Small foot print. easy to configure, ethernet option available for homes that don't have good line of site, very fast!

Title: eerp 3 pack
Review Comment: very user friendly, setup was very fast almost effirtless, range has been greatly improved and speed is faster

Title: Bad for remote access.
Review Comment: It's not working at all for remote database access.  Nothing needed to be configured on the previous Apple AirPort Extreme to allow remote access.  However with Eero, we had to set up port forwarding.  After the port forwarding set up, it got messier from there.  We were only able to access the database from out-of-home network or cell data.  When we are in the Eero network, we'll receive a server not reachable error message.  Eero tech support said they will consider this feature.  I am not sure what feature they are talking about.It's a great device if you are only using it for web, email, and other stuff.  But I'd avoid it if you need any remote access to your home network.  Not working.  "NAT loopback" or "hairpin NAT" should be supported like any other routers!

Title: Works for most things
Review Comment: The Eero is a neat idea, and I was really exciting about having better coverage throughout my home. Unfortunately, it doesn't work well with my WiFi Camera. Every two weeks, the device looses it's connection to my network and has to be reset and reconfigured.  Big pain! And I waited too long to return it, because the Eero folks were trying to help figure it out, though not very effectively. Now I've got these two devices, and just want to get rid of them so I can stop worrying about my camera.

Title: Thanks eero for a great product!
Review Comment: Absolutely excellent technology.  We were using a high-end router and 3 extenders in an effort to obtain consistent speeds.  The install is easy and the app is very well-designed.  We have as many as 25 connected devices including computers, tablets, TVs, Amazon Echos (5 of them!), Ring doorbells & cameras, Hue lights, WEMO switches etc. and the network is rock solid.  There is no more yelling from our son's area in the far end of the house.  Note we have a house with older and probably odd construction so even line-of-sight from the old router wasn't working too well.  As I write this we are getting 109 down Mbps / 12 up.  The most I've noticed is 115 down.  No more daily router reboots from the cable modem in fact I haven't rebooted them at all since installation.  Netflix performance is very much improved and rarely goes out.  My guess is that the other router was having issues so the connections were varying in speed.  For us Eero is worth every dollar as Internet peace reigns supreme in our home.  Thanks to everyone who wrote real reviews prior to my purchase as they helped me make my purchase decision.

Title: Excellent
Review Comment: These eeros did exactly what they say they do. My entire house is blanketed in wifi at full strength. I also like the option of running a wired backhaul and appreciate the extra LAN port. I also like that you have options that you can configure to customize your network. Oh, and for people with a lot of LIFX bulbs, I have 25 of them plus all of my other wifi products (over 35 clients all at the same time) and no problem at all!

Title: Made an enormous positive change at our house
Review Comment: Having spent money over and over on various wifi extenders, it was a joy to be able to install this product quite easily and for it to work really well, just about instantaneously.The concept is elegant, you add more if you need to, and I believe they all take care of the housekeeping between them, handing you from one to the other as you move around your house.No more waiting while my device hunts for a different supplier of the same wifi signal while it switches from the main wifi to the range extender.No more 'the server timed out because your device appears to be offline' messages. I would always think "I didn't stop paying for that internet - it's still there, and I shouldn't have to coax a device into communicating with my router".Also the design is pleasing, the squared-off white hockey puck doesn't look like much wherever it's placed, and the cord from the bit that plugs into the wall outlet is long enough that you have placement options.It's also cool that you can programmatically turn off the little white 'on' light

Title: Immediately returning due to cell phone number requirement
Review Comment: I just received this in the mail and unfortunately will now be returning it after finding out the setup process requires you to enter your phone number so they can send you a code via text to authenticate you. This is a deal breaker for me so back it goes. I called their support to confirm and I will say, I got a real human, on a weekend, who spoke perfect English, within about a minute and no complicated menus, so that was cool. But still - he said there's no way to do set up without a cell phone number.I'm just going to pick up some WiFi APs from the local electronics store, put them in bridge mode and put them on the existing wired network. The way this system works, it takes the place of your router and I use my router's NAT features for a few wired home automation services, cameras, gaming, etc. so I wouldn't be able to use the routing function of these access points anyway. They basically end up acting as expensive, bridges WiFi access points. Even if I were using the Eeros access points as routers, I don't really buy the claim that the home router is the bottleneck. Doesn't seem to make sense that a gigabit router would be the bottleneck on a 50Mb Comcast circuit. But hey, I'm no network engineer, who knows.Mostly annoyed about the phone number though. Lame.

Title: Solve your home wifi problems once and for all with this unit!
Review Comment: This new technology is as good an improvement as I could have hoped for.  I have Comcast high speed internet, very fast and I use the latest Apple Airport Extreme for my router.  We have a large house (3700 square feet) and we have many bad spots with poor speed.  For example my Apple Macbook Air in our kitchen sometimes is as slow as 2-5 mbps, while if I put the laptop next to the router (which is upstairs) I can get 100-175 mbps.  I also noticed that Apple has announced they are getting out of the router business--that suggested to me they realize their technology isn't keeping up and perhaps they don't want to invest in this area.  So I bought the 3-pack Eero and set it up, total time probably 20-25 minutes.  I chose to sort of triangulate my house, two units upstairs at each end of the house and one in the kitchen.  Despite the fact that Eero says it may take 24 hours to get up to full speed I am getting 125-175 mbps everywhere---yeehaa!  My Facetime to London was better and my Ring doorbell videos are much better.  One tip for setting it up:  Eero said to plug in the first unit and the modem simultaneously,  but the Comcast modem takes about a minute to connect so the Eero unit seemed to be struggling to connect.  I would suggest plugging in the modem first, let it show all the lights up and running, then plug in the Eero.  One other thought; some online reviews complain about the somewhat higher price of the Eero vs. Google wifi versus Orbi for example.  I think this is a mistake.  Having the best and fastest wifi in one's home is about as important as anything you have running in your house.  I am willing to pay extra for the best solution which this clearly is.

Title: Pricey...but no more frustratiom
Review Comment: Awesome.  Super DUPER easy to install.  Had to order a 4th to accomodate for our house layout.  Easy to reserve IP for Printers too.  Now I'm fighting with Frontier though as the eero's check WAN speeds daily...and I'm not getting what I pay for with my ISP.

Title: Chord cutters dream
Review Comment: I picked eero to upgrade my wifi. I had an older Apple airport and was waiting for the next generation of Airports. Apple instead discontinued their Airports. I was a little hesitant at the switch to eero. I've used non Apple routers before, and was somewhat dreading the set up. I opened the box and then down loaded the app to my iPhone. It walked me through the set up like a stroll in the park. Set up number one, then it asked if I wanted to do another and then again for the third. I options for network control were easy to see and work. Family member restrictions for the children were easier than on the airport. The look and feel was more Apple like than Apples own products. I wish I'd switched earlier. Streaming to my AppleTVs has improved with less buffering. Streaming live TV through my HDHomerun extend has improved markedly. For people considering chord cutting that have multiple TVs, eero is a must have upgrade for your wifi.

Title: Skeptical at first but...
Review Comment: Skeptical at first but now a believer in mesh technology. I would like to see the ability to dim/turn off the LED between certain hours, for eeros that are in bedrooms. Right now it is On or Off. A few other times that eero is lacking:-QoS-IPv6-VLANsOther than that, I am happy with the performance and the sleek desktop setup.

Title: Works great!
Review Comment: So far so good.  The system works really well.  My only complaint might be the price, but that really depends on how many you need and if you are buying multiple good routers to solve a similar problem you end up in the same ballpark.

Title: Made internet great again!
Review Comment: Eero is the best!  I don't know how I ever lived without it.  Eero made my internet great again!

Title: and built I would strongly recommend this product to anyone
Review Comment: I just installed the three eero's and that was the easiest setup I've ever done with wi-fi equipment. So well packaged, engineered, and built I would strongly recommend this product to anyone. It's only day one for the wi-fi use but so far I can tell it's a huge improvement over what we had before which was a combo modem/router by CenturyLink and it was problematic. I have high hopes those glitchy problems we had in the past are just that, in the past.

Title: Felt abandoned by Apple...
Review Comment: I was one of those people that felt abandoned by Apple when they announced they were not supporting their routers any more! I (stupidly) tried CUJO as I was looking for a unit that would help me with security with internet of things. For reasons I will not go into here, I quickly abandoned them because of the very security problem I was trying to get away from. With lots more investigation I looked for another solution. I came across eero, installed it and have not looked back since. I will simply say that if you are looking for an all around state of the art mesh network (wired) wireless routers that you can easily manage with their app and feel secure in this new internet of things world...eero is it! Don't worry about their cost... they are worth it... even at twice the price. They are "monitored" with upgrades as needed for the purchase price. A fact that every new purchaser should consider when buying a new secure system. Think before you buy... and choose eero (I am not an employee).

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Amazing difference!

Title: Game changing internet access - have put in 2 homes!
Review Comment: I have now bought two Eero systems - one for our home and one for our beach house.  This product is awesome!  Installation is easy and intuitive, and the "mesh" approach has ended dead spots in our homes.  Beats our old Apple access points by miles.  I don't do many reviews, but this product is one of the best I have ever gotten - I would recommend it strongly!

Title: Great Investment
Review Comment: Absolutely love this system. After shopping and returning many items that didn't perform as I wanted, I invested in the Eero system. Totally worth every dollar! Now I can get wifi in every part of my house. 3 levels and 4,000+ sq ft I haven't had anywhere in the house with a weak signal! Wish I bought this a long time ago!

Title: Easy to use! Works Great!
Review Comment: Easy to setup and use! I had a question about placing them and called technical support. They were amazing answered my questions quickly and thoroughly. You can monitor your network remotely from their app and see where any issues in the network are. It covers my whole home without any issues! I would highly recommend to any friends or family looking for a whole home mess network setup!

Title: Our Eero works perfectly
Review Comment: We bought the three pack - one for my upstairs office where the Internet comes in via a cable modem, one for the kitchen, one for the living room. The system works beautifully throughout the house.

Title: this is the future of home networking - for sure!
Review Comment: extremely easy to set up, remote management via app and very stable.  Eero has made my mesh network possible, coverage in every room, nothing drops out - my 6 eero have replaced my 7 apple airport routers (4 extremes and 3 express). I have very thick walls and have ethernet to most places bar two. the key thing is that my apple network would drop out in some rooms and I had to actually reboot the devices for it to work again, and would only find out they weren't working when I was out of the house and it was little I could do remotely.the Eeros, are not as fast as the apple airport extremes, but they are reliable, solid, offer remote management and are self healing - so for all intents and purposes are a much better solution for my home.  The company service team is also top notch, via email or the phone. the ability to run tests remotely, check at your configuration, reboot the network its great.  I highly recommend this for people who have a complex network (either because of the size of the home or the thickness of walls) and / or people who want to have remote management capabilities and hopefully a set and forget network.this is the future of home networking - for sure.

Title: Seamless operation & full home coverage
Review Comment: Even though I had purchased a high end router, I found I still needed to use a range extender ((also high end) to cover all areas of our 1800 sq ft main level with full basement home. I was having two continuing issues. First issue, I was having to reboot the system often, sometimes more than once daily. Secondly, because I had the router in the basement and the range extender on the main level, when I walked from the main level (connected to the range extender) to the basement, the phone would automatically switch connection to the router. When I returned upstairs, the phone would remain connected to the router which was not strong enough strength to do anything so I would have to go to wifi settings on the phone & manually select it for the range extender. Not a big deal unless you travel to the basement like I do probably 20 times daily.I stumbled on something discussing the Eero system and then read many reviews on them and other whole house wifi systems. I decided to purchase a three Eero pack. It was super easy to install, it has been over three months and I have not had to reboot one time, and because my phone sees it as one wifi connection, I can now travel throughout the house with strong signal strength and internet speed.I have one in the basement, one on the main level, and the third one connected to an older TiVo that does not have wireless connection - connected to the Eero ethernet port.For me, it proved to be the end of frustration  of a system that just wasn't working well.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Great product! It simply works!

Title: A happy customer-Instant gain of 2x of the wifi speed upon eero installation
Review Comment: Got the eero's this afternoon. It took me no time to set up. Unplugged my Apple Time Machine, plugged in one of the eeros, started up the eero app on my phone--viola! Everything started to work. I tested the wireless speed at various places in the house before and after eeros: In most of the areas the speed increased 2x, just like that! In a couple of "dead" zones, the speed went up 3x (to where the speed was right by the Time Machine). Like one reviewer said, the laws of physics still apply: In the farthest corner of the house (including one of the "dead" zones), the speed is only ½ of the speed in the other areas of the house, but totally usable now (unlike before eero). My Apple TV used to be connected by a cable (the wifi was too slow). I connected the Apple TV via the wireless just to see if that works--the connection was FAST.One eero is in a room separated from the rest of the house by a set of heavy duty sliding glass doors. The other one is about 30+ feet away, equal distance from one end of the house to the other (where the other eero is). I am pretty certain 2 eeros are sufficient, but if not, I can add another one.It took me a while to make up my mind to ditch the Apple router and extenders. I loved my Apple products, but the wifi just never fast enough even for basic web browser. I switched the network from hidden to not hidden, added extenders, tweaked the modem settings (to the extent I could find instructions), nothing helped. I paid extra for faster speed--didn't make a dent. Before buying the eeros, I agonized over what to do with my 3-year old Apple Time Machine. Well, once I saw how fast the wifi was with eeros, no more worries. I will still use the Time Machine for backup, but that's it.I am not sure what makes the wifi gain 2x the speed with eeros (am not referring to the "mesh" effect either), but the speed gain plus the mesh (aka blanketing) effect really makes a difference with tricky situations. So far I am very very happy.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: This system rocks!

Title: Easy installation and much improved speed and wifi signal throughout the house
Review Comment: Overall, I enjoyed a very easy, snag-free installation process with Eero.  I also bought the 3-Eero pack and a new modem at the same time.  I don't know how much of the improvement to internet speed over wifi that I've enjoyed since installing both can be credited to Eero versus the new modem or the combination of the two, but we do seem to have far better speed and coverage throughout our house.  We do not pay for business-class service through our cable provider, just a slightly upgraded conventional service, but before installing Eero, my internet connection in my office upstairs was slow as molasses -- online speed tests showed download speeds of anywhere from 2 to 6 Mbps, and now I'm consistently around 50 Mbps, according to the Eero app.  We've had only the occasional hiccup with streaming music or video entertainment with the new setup, most of which we do in the upstairs areas of our house.  My only gripe, and it's no fault of the Eero, is that I had to reinstall all three of our Nest smoke detectors after setup, which required pulling them out of the ceiling and resetting them all.  At least climbing up and down the ladder all those times made for some good exercise.

Title: The Best Thing Since Sliced Bread
Review Comment: Takes the worry out of being far (from your router). I have a system of 5 in my house, and get a strong signal throughout, something that did not occur prior to the eero. The app and the firmware keep getting upgraded with each iteration becoming better than the prior version. The support department is excellent with a fast accurate response each time.Frankly, I couldn't be happier. My only complaint is that I didn't invent it!

Title: Great wi-fi solution
Review Comment: Super simple installation and easy to manage via the iPhone app.  Love the fact you can create profiles for the various devices although I wish you had the ability to pause specific devices without having them attached to profiles.

Title: Excellent wi fi home coverage
Review Comment: This is the third eero that I have added to my single story home and I have excellent coverage.I have been using the system for over 6 months, and highly recommend it.

Title: Setup was easy, but performance not so good
Review Comment: Setup was easy, but performance not so good.  I measure speed of wifi through eero and again directly through wifi router.  The router is always at least 75% faster

Title: Two Stars
Review Comment: decent coverage, but does not replace all equipment, thus adds on.

Title: This system is super simple to set up using the app and blankets ...
Review Comment: No more wifi dead spots in my house.This system is super simple to set up using the app and blankets the house with coverage. I also took the time to change the DNS server to Verisign, which seemed to speed up the resolving of websites.

Title: AMAZING AND WORTH EVERY CENT
Review Comment: AMAZING AND WORTH EVERY CENT!!!! This is sooooo easy to set up and the performance is superior to any wifi connection I've had.  If only I had found it sooner.  Don't hesitate to buy it - the 2-pack was perfect for my 1,800 square foot, 2 story townhouse.  Money well spent!!

Title: I've been using the system for about a month now and I'm quite satisfied with the product
Review Comment: There are a few brands offering wireless mesh networking for a lower price than Eero, but after doing my homework, I decided to spend the extra bucks and go with Eero. I've been using the system for about a month now and I'm quite satisfied with the product. Setup was a breeze and took only a few minutes. One of the units was defective, and died shortly after setup. Upon calling support, I was delighted to have the phone answered on the second ring by a real human being who was knowledgeable, and spoke English. He immediately had a new unit shipped out. While waiting for its arrival, I set up with the remaining two units, and found they were adequate to cover my entire 4,500 square foot house! Now, with three units going, I have great coverage in every nook and cranny, and the signal has not dropped once. It works flawlessly, and invisibly. I dropped one star only because the bottoms of the units seem to run warm, although thus far  it hasn't  affected performance.

Title: MVPe - Most Valuable Purchase ever!
Review Comment: My WiFi change to eero has been my single best purchase this year.  The ease of installation, the immediate gratification, and the peace and tranquility of uninterrupted streaming in this household as a result of eero are immeasurable.  Thank you!

Title: Wifi could not be easier or better
Review Comment: Very easy to set up, even for a non I.T. person!Works great from our basement to our second floor. We bought the 3 unit pack.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Simple set up!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: THIS IS THE BEST ROUTER PERIOD.

Title: I was skeptical, but I am SO happy I bought this!
Review Comment: Our house was the dreaded dead zone. The modem/router was in the room directly above our living room, yet we would still have trouble keeping a wifi connection on the smart tv in the living room. I was so angry, paying for the highest internet speed but dropping connections all the time! We had tried 3 different internet companies, and a wifi extender, plus we tried two different modems on our current internet provider...to no avail. I was convinced that I would forever have to deal with buffering and rebooting devices. A few weeks back I googled "how to get rid of dead wifi zones" and several articles about "mesh" wifi came up...then it dawned on me that my company has mesh wifi for our building of 12,000 people, so I know it works! I saw this company had good reviews, and a lot of the happy customers had had all of the same experiences I did, which were fixed by Eero.Oh. My. God. I wish I had this years ago! Installation was really easy, and as soon as the devices were hooked up I was running around the house streaming YouTube/Netflix/Amazon Fire Stick on every tv, and every computer simultaneously...No buffering on anything! I have not had any connection problems since that day.I was sent a new modem by Spectrum today (since they bought time warner) and I did have trouble reconfiguring the eero with the new modem. However, after spending 3 hours on the phone with Spectrum I gave up and called Eero, and they were able to walk me through every step. They did a lot of the work remotely on their side, updating the network and explaining the reason the new modem didn't automatically recognize the device. I was good to go, and now everything works brilliantly with the new modem. I promise you, if you had trouble like I did with dead zones, YOU NEED THIS!

Title: Awesome,awesome, awesome!
Review Comment: Best wireless I have ever had.  Everyone should have it!

Title: GREAT PRODUCT! But may require call to tech support to update before it works.
Review Comment: Ok love this device.  I am using it not only as a powerful router but also for internet control.  It has great features to add profiles, set bedtimes, and also automatically pause the internet on one person's devices at anytime.  There is no web safety content filtering however so it is the only feature it is really missing. ONE IMPORTANT NOTE!!!  When I  bought this I thought it didn't work because it said everything was out of range but it just needed a software update which required a call to tech support.  Don't be afraid to call them. They were super helpful and got me up and running. Purchased February 2017 so this may be fixed later on down the road as new devices are shipped with the update include.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: very easy to setup and works perfectly

Title: Love the eero
Review Comment: Works great no more buffering on Netflix!  Our range extenders we bought had worked MOST of the time but would still buffer occasionally!  With the EERO no problems!  Works great in our 2600 square foot house!  Would buy again!  Great product and easy to set up!

Title: Big speed boost with big headaches
Review Comment: While the speed boost is spectacular, up from 10-15 mbps to 50-70 mbps, this thing has been a headache the whole way through, causing a bunch of odd connection issues. Worse, one of the three just died 4 days after the return window, Eero said they can't help with a return. I'm really frustrated.The first issue is Netflix wouldn't connect through it. I spent about 4 hours trying to diagnose it setting things up in different ways, calling Samsung (who makes the BluRay) and Netflix. Then spending an hour with Eero support only to conclude it couldn't be fixed. (It doesn't work with a Sony BluRay I have either.) I bought two more, newer Samsung BluRays, but they didn't work either. I returned those and got a Google Chromecast, which does work great. It's a first world problem, as is the fact that I now need two devices to watch Netflix or BluRays, but better wifi is what I paid for, right?Another odd issue that may or may not be related is that apps won't download on our iPhones or iPad anymore, they hang up partway through the download, I have to connect to my phone carrier and download them from there, which works fine.At this point, I've spent over 15 hours trying to get Eero working right. I'm tired. I want to send it back. But I can't return it because the third unit died 2/8, the return window closed 1/31. So I just burned $400. You might try Google's equivalent product instead. I'm bummed and frustrated.

Title: It was easy to set up
Review Comment: Our new eero system works!  I have spent a fortune (well a lot) on extenders, "bridges," and more powerful routers).  I could never get full wifi coverage in my house.  Now, we are completely covered.  We currently have nine devices working off of our three unit eero system.  It was easy to set up.  We have had the system for about three months. I can't comment on eero's customer support service; we've never had the need to use it.

Title: I Absolutely LOVE These!
Review Comment: I have had these installed in our office for a month now and am 100% satisfied and very impressed with them.I am a partner of a financial advising firm. We recently purchased and renovated a two story 3,500 sqft house for our new office. The house was built in the early part of the 1800's. the walls on this house are 12" thick and solid concrete and brick. I was very concerned that I was going to struggle to get wifi signal properly dispersed into all the rooms of the building.I put the first AP on the main floor. The other two are upstairs in different offices. I did a thorough site survey and am getting very strong signal in every room and around the outside perimeter of the building. This was true even with our mobile devices.The initial installation was remarkably simple to on my iPhone 7 using the EERO app. One of the valuable "extra" features of this system are the duavailable Ethernet ports on the back of each device. My office manager uses a tower-style PC. It has no wireless capability. His office has no hardwired Ethernet ports in it. We were able to put one of the EERO devices in his office and run an Ethernet cable from the device over to his PC. He gets excellent connectivity and function.I am very particular about my tech and expect it to perform as best as is possible. I could not be more pleased with the wifi speeds I am getting from this system. As well, none of my people have had any trouble whatsoever connecting to the wifi signal and getting good reliable service.I will surely use these again when I need a wifi solution!

Title: AWESOME FOR OUR WHOLE HOUSE COVERAGE
Review Comment: AWESOME FOR OUR WHOLE HOUSE COVERAGE!  NO DEAD ZONES ANYMORE!!!!  WE HAVE A 1200 SQ FT AND I HAVE NOT FOUND MANY PLACES THAT DO NOT GET DEDICATED SIGNAL FROM THE EERO.

Title: eero mesh wi-fi !!!
Review Comment: Wow !!! The eero mesh wi-if is absolutely the very bestwi-fi system. We have always had spotty at best wi-fi coverage in our large 2 story home, until we purchased the eero wi-fi system and now it's absolutely fantastic with super fast speeds and with excellent whole house coverage. Buy eero, you won't be disappointed.John K. Lowrance

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: eero are remarkable products providing WiFi throughout my house where previously we had numerous dead zones.

Title: So far so good. I tried a few other routers that just ...
Review Comment: I have had system installed for a week. So far so good. I tried a few other routers that just couldn't push the wifi signal.

Title: Worth the price
Review Comment: A little pricey but outstanding wi-fi signal strength throughout our home. Easy set up as well.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Excellent product that more than solved our internet problem throughout the house.
Easy installation.. works great on all 3 floors

Title: one major problem
Review Comment: Update to four stars:  eero released firmware update to fix dropped wifi call issue. Ha went extensively tested it yet but company is improving product constantly. They get another star!So so close. But one major problem depending on your situation.Good: Great packagingGreat user set upGreat designGreat appGreat coverageBad: Cannot transfer Wi-Fi phone calls between nodes without dropping the call every single time.  In my situation this is a major inconvenience. I do not have cell phone coverage in my home. I must be mobile as I talk to move between studio and office. The lack of being able to handoff wifi calling to nodes is a rather large disappointment for my particular situation.

Title: Definitely not worth the money- stay away!
Review Comment: This wifi system is junk. I spent $500 on it, and it can't even transition a device (say, an iPad) between eero's when I move throughout my house. Instead the iPad will show poor connectivity until,it completely disconnects. Usually I have to shut off wifi on the iPad, turn it back on and the it reconnects to the closest eero. Also, sitting in one place and browsing the web, I will often lose connectivity for 5-10 seconds.eero tech support has been relatively responsive over email (I haven't tried phone support), but they aren't helping to root cause the problem and don't seem to treat this as a priority either.It's sad - I paid $500 for this 3-pack of wifi access points. Definitely would fine a different solution if I could - this is not the reliable wirelsss I was looking for!

Title: Returned Google WiFi (GWF) since it didn't have a bridge ...
Review Comment: Returned Google WiFi (GWF) since it didn't have a bridge mode and created its own subnet.  Long story short, if you have a network that requires any degree of sophistication, GWF isn't really the answer.  Enter Eero that has a bridge mode that allows you keep your existing network architecture if you need it. Installation was supposed to be plug and play but it failed on a firmware update.  While customer support was very responsive and friendly, I basically had to find my own way to update the firmware on one recalcitrant unit.  Cost me probably 5 hours of my life I won't ever get back.  Expensive given the pain and suffering, but everything is working now and the mesh network is performing as advertised.

Title: Excellent streaming ability, even with multiple 1080p cameras
Review Comment: Feb 8, 2017 update:They just released the 2.2.0 firmware update yesterday.  It is supposed to have fixed delays in switching access points when roaming, down to something like 50ms, among other things.  This problem affected people using WiFi calling on Apple devices, where the call might drop if moving about.  Also, I did notice streaming apps would lose connection when the connection dropped.  It does appear to be better, but have yet to extensively test, but support page feedback looks very positive.  They do update firmware every month or two, and actively post on their community and reddit pages.  One positive I want to mention is that streaming performance outside, where I used to have serious issues by the pool, appears to be much better now than with my old (but recent) Apple router, even though the main node is placed in the same room as before (and is closest to the pool).  Looking forward to seeing how well this works this summer.  So while there are cheaper options out there, this does have very good customer support and a much more mature product than something like the Google WiFi.  Also noticed that Wifi signal is unaffected while a microwave oven is on--I was able to stream on my phone while sitting right next to it, which is a pleasant surprise.  One more thing.  Be wary of critical reviews containing outdated info, especially the featured ones here.  Firmware updates move quickly (for the networking space), so you should really go to the Eero community support or reddit pages to get the most current feedback so you don't pass over the product due to negative reviewers who won't update/remove their reviews because they'll lose their up votes.Original:This replaced an Airport Extreme and 2 Airport Express extenders. One issue with the old setup is that when moving around the house, devices would stay locked with degraded unusable connections for too long and not switch. Another is that I needed to get streaming to work flawlessly because I am planning to add multiple Nest Cam Outdoor Security Camera 2 pack. Once I added a Skybell HD I could see issues because that device gets bogged down an unreliable without a very robust WiFi signal. While moving the Express around helped, I could still see the signal strength fluctuate even when connected to it, just located on the other side of the wall. Also, with one Nest cam streaming continuously, there would be hiccups with that stream when the Skybell was also recording. All these issues seem to have disappeared since installing the Eeros, and now I've ordered another two Nest cams and upgraded the Skybell to use full 1080 video instead of degraded 480 or 720 options.Installation was very very easy. I mean not a single issue with the Eeros themselves, but I did disable/enable Wifi on two Macs and reboot of a Slingbox 500. I appreciated that they allow you to do configure some advanced networking features, and while there does not appear to be user configurable QoS yet, their web page says there is a basic implementation in place, and that they may offer more capabilities.Even if you don't buy this mesh networking product, most people would be better off with one over a traditional router because these vendors are actively competing on features and performance with aggressive firmware updates, and the only thing a tradition router will get is a once in a blue moon security update. On that note, I would discourage people from an Orbi, since that appears to be a gussied up Netgear with the latest specs. Once you take a look at the browser configuration interface, it will be very familiar to anyone who has had a Netgear router, devoid of any imagination or cutting edge features or modern interface. No useful info about clients offered. At least for the Eero, I could not find a single review claiming the routers needed periodic rebooting, as we are all accustomed to, even with the Apple products (though better than Dlink or Netgear routers).Eero is the one recommended by Leo Laporte, as I saw on his feed, though since Eero is a sponsor, objectivity could be compromised. I was seriously thinking about the Amplifi since the router itself is uber cool, but I had issues with the very large satellites and their orientation, as well as a number of reviews suggesting things like poor performance or quality control issues. One thing that sold me about the Eero is their claim that their implementation performs active routing, as you will see on the blog post explaining the TrueMesh technology. So if one node is busy, it can reroute traffic to another, which makes these satellites behave more like routers actually employing an active routing protocol. From speaking with Amplifi tech support, I was not convinced that the roaming functionality would work seamlessly, but I can't speak from first hand experience. While I might buy and try still, so far I'm content with the Eeros.Let me say that some of the earlier reviews, say pre-Nov 17 2016, do not have the benefit of using the 2.x firmware. I fully expect many reviews addressing performance as a concern are out of date since they don't reflect current reality. My unit shipped with 1.2 firmware, and once I updated to 2.1, the WAN throughput doubled from 55Mbps to 110Mbps, my ISP limit. I may pay another $10 per month to upgrade my ISP speed once I get enough Nest cams to tax my upper limit (11Mbps) on the upload. From the Nest webpage, each cam at 1080p uses 450 Kbps (0.45 Mbps) upload on average, and 1.2Mbps max, so really I should be well under the ISP max with a number of camera streaming. The 802.11ac protocol, used by the Eeros, supports 1.3 Gbps, or 1331 Mbps, so for anyone curious, the protocol between the Eeros should have more than ample room to support numerous 1080 streams, plus a 4K stream with ease.Upgrading firmware was easy--I just pushed the option in the IOS app to upgrade, and it proceeded to upgrade all three devices. Even those with recent purchases may not have taken the initiative to update the firmware, so that is something to consider when reading reviews since most people don't report what they are using.I did seriously consider the Google Wifi, but was concerned about the immaturity and lack of any advanced features. It might work for average users, but for instance, from what I read you cannot even specify a preferred subnet. While perhaps that might change with future updates, with the Eero you get a maturing product, versus a very new Google product. The one concern I have with Eero is the high price.  I guess you would want to buy this if you want superior customer support with a lot of attention placed on advancing the product's capabilities.  And probably because it is, at this point, more mature than a number of recent offerings.One thing that bothered me before purchasing was the lack of line of sight that they recommend. My primary router is in a corner room, and not central in the house, and invariably goes through drywall covered walls. I was researching Power over Ethernet to use a a backhaul to the Eero satellites, but decided to setup and test without POE. So far, I can say I don't see a reason I will ever need to use POE with these existing two satellites. One issue with what I found on POE products offered on amazon is that I would be worried about periodic rebooting and troubleshooting of those devices. So my advice for anyone similarly concerned about line of sight is to try it naked first and figure out a way to place within rooms that minimizes obstructions. Obviously, anyone with Cat 6 interior cabling already installed would want to use that.

Title: Not great for a vertically tall house
Review Comment: Not great for a vertically tall house. My house is 4 stories tall and it is tough for the signal to run up and down. For $500 I expected more.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: I have 4 of these covering my house.. I get 200+mbps Internet downloads everywhere...

Title: I am very happy with EERO!
Review Comment: I purchased  3 pack several weeks ago to replace an old set of routers I had at my previous house.  I moved to a 2000 square foot ranch house that is spread out more than my old house. The old routers and extenders were not handling everything thoughout the house and yard.  When I moved I purchased a 75MB service.  The best service I could get from the old routers inside the house was 29MB.  After hearing about EERO on the podcast IOS Today I started reading the reviews for the EERO over several weeks I finally decided to purchase the 3 pack.  It was amazing how easy it  was to install the three units.  I did not have any probems getting them up and running. The modem is down in the basement so the first EERO is down there next to the modem.. The next one is on the main level in the middle of the house to the front of the house in the office.  The third one is about 30 feet away from the one in the basement but on the main level on the back side of the house.  Coverage is fantastic inside the house, the garage  and out in the front yard and back yard!  I now receive the 75MB that I am paying for and have great coverage everywhere!  I like the idea that the system will be updated automatically.  Everyone in the family is happy that we have made the move to EERO!

Title: Eero Rocks
Review Comment: Mesh wifi is a big jump forward for home or business wifi.

Title: Best WIFI system ever
Review Comment: after having struggled for years with a set of "linked" routers, this system was game changing. Installed 5 units in about 20 minutes.  Works seamlessly, and the internet never goes down or has to be "reset".  Cant believe I didnt get this sooner.  Expensive but worth it.  I connected 3 with Network cables, and 2 just wirelessly.  Amazing coverage, and it shift resources to maintain necessary speeds.  Best investment in years for my home.

Title: works great
Review Comment: I love this product I have the same Mbps all over my home that comes in on my modem . would recommend this system to everyone easy to set up and works like a charm.

Title: This product is fantastic.
Review Comment: This is the easiest to install router I've ever seen by a factor of 3.  It was a piece of cake.  Also, the product is working exactly as described (so far) and our house is totally covered in speedy wi-fi.  We're experiencing higher download speeds than we were with a different router as well.  It is noticeably faster, and I haven't had to reset it or the modem once in several months.  This product is fantastic.

Title: Doesn't work well and waited too late to learn this
Review Comment: I was busy with family emergencies and didn't set it up until, unfortunately, after the return window had closed by a few days.  So almost $500 for a system that isn't anywhere near as good as the $50 system from Best Buy.  I have 3 units and can't get coverage beyond the gateway room.  And yes, I've followed all the advice, elevations, moved around, non-obstructions, etc.  Lesson learned:  now matter what's going on in your personal life, see if it works in the first week so you don't get stuck.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: wonderful system  no more buffering . full  house covered how great is this .

Title: ... as advertised which I never believe but I was happy to be proven wrong
Review Comment: Works as advertised which I never believe but I was happy to be proven wrong. The eero network was easy to install and my home now has complete WiFi coverage and the coverage is full strength at any location in the house. Thanks eero creators!!

Title: Easy to install
Review Comment: Easy to install, good coverage, works a lot better than 2 modems that I used to have. Installed 3 units. A+

Title: Works as promised
Review Comment: Very satisfied: works as promised, easy to install

Title: Great, unless you want dropped wireless connections
Review Comment: I don't know why this product as so many positive reviews.  My experience has been bad with lots of dropped wireless connections.  When using a mobile device such as an iPhone, it will occasionally drop wireless for a second or two.  This is with me being about 20ft from the router and not moving.  It can do this several times in a 15 to 20 minute window.  I have contacted their Tech support a couple of times, and all they say is reboot the eero and you phone.  I didn't pay this kind of money for a router that I have to constantly reboot.  I even tried running with just one Eero and had the same results.Their mobile app is nice, but their gateway hardware or software (don't know which) is crap.  I would suggest going to the Google Wifi or Apple Airport solution and avoid this one.

Title: Wireless everywhere!
Review Comment: This has been a huge upgrade for our wireless at the house. No more dead spots, full strength everywhere, and fast! Even the little Roku stick in the back room plays smoothly now! Highly recommended if you're having trouble getting signal everywhere!

Title: Meh, not great depending on how you use it
Review Comment: While I never dropped wifi completely, as promised in their marketing stuff, the problem with not dropping is how poor performance can get before it does drop. I'd be sitting 10-15 feet from the AP and suddenly go from 300Mbps to 1-2Mbps, or 0% packet loss to 3-4% without anything shifting or changing in the house. I'd watch my signal meter in the MacBook change from high to low and back like a yo-yo at all times. On the nice side, I had basic connectivity all the way into the elevator in my building, a good 50 meters from the AP, but often I had no signal from across the unobstructed room.Pros:-Signal never dropped, like ever. Would work 50M away through walls and concrete with (limited) connectivity-Able to use Facebook and Skype and other basic services without issue-Streamed video up to 1080P on my Amazon Fire TV which was 1-2 feet awayCons:-Sometimes at close range I would have unusable wifi, connected but so choppy it was useless-Video at 1080P was rare, often the best I could get was 2-3Mbps 720P on Fire TV-Text services were good but media services suffered big time

Title: "Easy as 1,2,3" Set-Up = GIANT PAIN IN THE ASS.
Review Comment: ACTUAL STEPS IT TOOK ME TO GET THIS TO WORK.1. Connect first unit to modem. Seems to work fine.2. Power on second unit about 30' away from first unit. Second unit refused to admit that it was close enough to the first unit to function at about 30' away.  Setup refuses to continue until it is close enough.3. Move second unit to 20' away, setup still says it's too far away.4. Move second unit to 10' away, setup still says it's too far away.5. Move second unit to 1' away, setup still says it's too far away.6. Return to main menu; alert tells me system needs an update; attempt update; update fails after 15 minutes.7. Attempt update again; update succeeds on first unit but fails on second unit.8. Check if updated first device fixed distance issue.  Nope.9. Consult Google.10. Hard wire second device to first device.  Ok, now it's close enough.  But when I unplug it, it's no longer close enough.11. Hard reset everything and start over.12. Connect first unit to modem.13. Hard wire second device to first device and complete addition to network.14. Hard wire third device via switch (since first device only has two ethernet ports) and complete addition to network.15. While everything is still wired together, install all updates.16. Unplug and distribute units, which now seem to think that a little distance is fine.Total installation time: 5-6 hours.Required equipment: another router or switch to temporarily create a network that all 3 units can be hardwired into, and so that you can continue to have internet to Google the solutions to all of this nonsense.Conclusion: set-up process needs SERIOUS WORK.Now that it's actually working, so far it appears to be working fine.  Not sure if it's really any faster than the AirPort I had before. It's definitely way more expensive.

Title: Otherwise I'm happy with my now +120 MBps feed
Review Comment: Using EERO 3 pack solved a 11+ year problem of iffy (at best) wi-fi.  Finding my solution was a fluke.  As I sat at my desk pondering returning the system, I saw the ethernet connector on EERO #3 and ran a cable directly from the EERO to my PC.  I then had the benefit of a hard-wired system without running a cable to the modem at the other end of the condo.  This would have been valuable information to give.  Otherwise I'm happy with my now +120 MBps feed.  Before EERO the MBps was under 20.

Title: The perfect solution
Review Comment: This is an amazing solution for hard to reach areas of a large property. We have a guest house that we needed to get covered by wifi, but didn't want the expense of a hard wired solution, and range extenders couldn't quite get the performance we wanted. This product blankets our property with full strength hi speed connectivity from the garage to the guest house and everywhere in between. Super fast and easy no-brainer setup. Very well thought out product and works like a charm.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Easy setup and works as described.  We now get a strong signal throughout the house.

Title: Say Good-Bye to poor WiFi and Hello to eero!
Review Comment: The setup was easy via the iOS app and now my house has complete 4-5 bar coverage throughout.  On average I have about 20 connected devices and do 4K streaming from Netflix without any issues.  I was so happy with the eero's in my house that I installed 6 of them in my church that is a large building with block interior walls that played havoc on the old access points.  I set these up in bridge mode and everything connected great.  Several non-techies have noticed that they now have strong coverage everywhere in the Church.  I love eero's commitment and continuous product improvement.

Title: EERO has alot of room for improvement.  Unfortunately, recent firmware upgrades have degraded bandwidth severely.
Review Comment: I have a network that consists of 9 EERO access points.  I purchased the first 6 before the company was even producing the product and became a beta tester.  Initially I was very pleased with the wifi coverage and bandwidth that was usually in the range of 20-45Mbps down and 90Mbps upload as measured by the EERO app.  My house is older and constructed with cement (cinder) blocks.  Previous to the eero it was nearly impossible to obtain wifi coverage from one end of the house to the other.  I used wifi repeaters, boosters, high gain antennas,  etc.  The house is single story.  Recently, EERO uploaded firmware upgrades (OS v2.2.0-2478) to all of my units and the entire network has fallen apart.  My download speed has dropped to  3-13 Mbps with upload speeds remaining in the 90Mbps range.  This is measured using eero's own app that supposedly measures the bandwidth at the gateway EERO.  I have measured the bandwidth with my laptop and desktop plugged into the same router and they consistently will measure download speeds of 93-96Mbps and upload speeds of 97-99Mbps as measured by Ookla speedtest.  I have emailed customer support on numerous occasions.  I have sent customer support a floorplan with the layout of the EERO mesh network including distances between the various eero access points.  I have moved the access points closer together, rebooted and implemented recommended "fixes".  What is particularly concerning is the fact only 3 of the 9 units have a signal that is considered good and the other 6 consistently have a signal that is rated poor by the EERO app.  This was not the case until this firmware upgrade.  I have asked for some answers but have not received any.  I guess it is time to chunk EERO and give Netgear's ORBI or Linksys Velop a try.  I will update this review if the mesh network starts to work as designed.

Title: Easy set up
Review Comment: Easy to set up from ios or android phone.  Easy to recommend

Title: Great. Solved long standing wifi problems in my rance home
Review Comment: Solved my long long standing WIFI problems in ranch home. Could not be more pleased. I still have so so internet from phone company but this made a lot of difficult wifi issues in my home just disappear. Had set up all three units in about 15 minutes. Easy. I am very technical but I love that, with these, I did not need to be. Plus, and big plus, these regularly update the firmware which makes them a lot more secure than the average garden variety wifi router that you need to regularly patch (and no one does because it's a big hassle to do that right).

Title: ... capsule Modem and results were exactly the same or worse. I followed the directions exactly High expectations
Review Comment: Tested speed of this expensive system up to my existing Apple tower time capsule Modem and results were exactly the same or worse. I followed the directions exactly High expectations, low tolerance for status quo given the price.

Title: Still undecided...
Review Comment: The jury is still out on this one. I love the idea of the system, and it seems to have extended the range of my wifi by quite a bit. There are still some serious issues with handoff between antennas and nodes, however. When using my devices (iPhone & iPad) while walking around the house, I am almost always getting booted off the network for a few seconds while it switches nodes. I'm hoping the upcoming 2.20 firmware will fix a lot of these issues. I just hope they release it before my return window closes.

Title: Easy to set up
Review Comment: Product works as advertised. Easy to set up, signal coverage is better than any Wi-Fi extender. Speeds are 8x faster. I used 3 systems to cover a 3200 square ft home(one story)

Title: Keeping the family happy!
Review Comment: WOW! Easy setup,simple and fast. I had little success with a high end router maintaining a signal in the kitchen (375 sq. ft.), a long way to the router. Tried a highly recommended signal booster and still lost access or had very slow speeds. We were always trying to reconnect with the router and would at times give up for the day.  With the Eero I had lightning fast speeds, 62mbps. Same problem upstairs until Eero installed. Everyone now happy and off of my case, it feels good not to be blamed for poor connectivity. I recommend the Eero system for anyone wishing to overcome the problems with the myriad of poor signal related issues. Remembering how many steps it took to set up a secure router in the past I called Eero customer service thinking I had missed several important steps. I connected with a real person in less than a minute and he walked me through the set up and explained Eero security. very happy with all aspects of this fine product, buy it with confidence that  your connectivity problems will be a thing of the past.

Title: Works Great!
Review Comment: Bought as a Christmas gift. Works great, easy setup. I had contacted Customer support for a question and response was quick and thorough.  Have had no issues with system and can now use cell phone  in the house where it was spotty before. Highly recommend.

Title: Great product, great value
Review Comment: Great product!

Title: This was easy to set up and performs flawlessly
Review Comment: I am not a technofile.  I just want things to work and work well. This was easy to set up and performs flawlessly.  It's expensive but at least it does what it is supposed to do.

Title: Good investment
Review Comment: I got two eeros for my apartment because I was sick of resetting my router every other day to get Internet.  Now, there are no dead spots, Internet works great around the clock, and I never have to think about network issues.  The app is simple and easy to use.  I can easily monitor all the devices that are connected to my network, and the guest network feature is cool.  Yes, they are pricey, but I consider this a worthwhile investment to never have to think about WiFi issues again.  It just works.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Signal strength and home coverage dramatically increased.  Well worth the investment

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works just as advertised, just the way all products should work!! But so seldom do.

Title: Not much to say, but that this system is great!
Review Comment: I rarely write reviews, but felt moved to write one after purchasing this system.I had tried everything to get steady wifi throughout our house.  Nothing worked until I installed this system.  Would highly highly recommend.

Title: Solved the weak wi-fi signal in 1920s home
Review Comment: I live with my family of four in a two storey 1800 square foot house built in the 1920s. The house is not open plan and the walls are mostly lath and plaster. Typically we have a dozen or more devices competing for bandwidth. I had been “surviving” on the modem/router (gateway) supplied by Comcast, but the wi-fi signal to most parts of my house was weak at best. In the living room it was often less than one Mbps. In the upstairs bedrooms it was frequently less than five Mbps.Before spending significant dollars on an Eero or Google wifi product, I purchased a new modem and new router, the latter a Linksys WRT1900ACS (I’ve since returned it). While it received good reviews for range, it made only marginal improvement in my home. In the living room where I plan to put a smart TV, it was still averaging under 10Mbps. So I decided to spring for one of the new mesh systems. I would have purchased Google wifi based upon the reviews, but they are out of stock everywhere.So I decided to go with Eero. I purchased the three pack, even though that would seem overkill based upon what I read. I managed to get one Eero in one of the upstairs bedrooms, in line of sight (when doors aren’t closed) with the base Eero in the home office. Now the upstairs bedrooms get 100Mbps much of the time, but certainly above 75Mbps. Problem solved. The third Eero I put in the kitchen two rooms over from the living room. To my slight surprise, the Chromecast on my current TV connected to the Eero in the bedroom, directly above it. The living room now gets greater than 75 Mbps most of the time. Back in the kitchen and the adjoining dining room, I’m also getting in excess of 75Mbps. The back yard also benefits from the third Eero. Problem solved.I may still try Google wifi, if I can get my hands on it before my return period ends with Amazon for the Eero, but if not, at least I can now enjoy awesome wi-fi coverage, even if it did cost me a few bucks more. As for the Eero - the set up was a breeze. My Sonos plugged in to the kitchen Eero worked first time, and the Eero app has worked flawlessly. The only slight disappointment, apart from the price, is not having the option to not broadcast the SSID. Perhaps that capability will come in one of their frequent updates. Also, I can’t see what devices are connected to a particular Eero, by selecting that Eero in the app. Instead I have to go to each device separately to see which Eero it is connected to.

Title: I love my eero!!!
Review Comment: I wanted to eliminate the need for wifi range extenders and have a single wireless network for my home. Eero made implementing a fast wireless network that covers my home simple and painless.

Title: Not worth the money at all!
Review Comment: We loved the eero at first, but now it constantly causes issues. Our devices drop the connection or it goes so slow that the endless wheel of death circles on our screens with our pages never updating until we switch to our old Wifi router, even if we are literally standing right next to the eero. We paid a lot of money for the eero and we are no better off than we were before. Do not waste your money on this.

Title: Don't know how I ever lived without this.
Review Comment: If you have spotty, weak WiFi in your home, this is the answer to your problems. True it is a bit pricey, but what you get in terms of simplicity of setup and reliability and speed of your connection makes this a worthwhile investment. Also, if you have small children, the Eero system gives you tools to easily limit internet access for your young ones. Awesome product!

Title: Our house is about 2200sf, everything is connected now ...
Review Comment: Our house is about 2200sf, everything is connected now including TIVO at each end of the house--streaming video flawlessly first from the DSL router, and wirelessly to the 3 eeros  spaced equally around the house, then to theTIVO and miniTIVO via MoCA. No need for cable or dish or cat 5 wiring, and we get local TV on a small digital antenna in the closet that is connected to Eero and then TIVO through the same internal  MoCA network.

Title: Cutting the cord
Review Comment: One of the easiet plug aand play devices I have ever installed. Although the system is a little pricey, we now longer have any dead / slow zones in the house at least we havent discovered any. Also we will regain our investment in a few short months once we cut the cable cord.Easy to follow directions, the system was completely installed in under 30 minutes. After installation I gathered every one in the house and had them log onto wifi with all the devices ; 4 cell phones, three tablets and one smart t.v, not one slow down any device.I appreciate that you can check the system anytime you want and the system checks itself and reports it to your device.

Title: Pricey but worth the investment.
Review Comment: This is a pricey system but worth the investment.  I replaced my ancient Apple AirPort, and had a fast mesh network running throughout the home 15 minutes after unboxing.  Speed is at the stated Comcast rate in every room.  Straightforward instructions through the mobile app.  No more Netflix/HBO queuing.  Well done Eero!

Title: I was getting better speeds on my older Apple airport extreme
Review Comment: I placed one of the three eero's in my office and the speeds there are slow. I pay for a 300Mbps x 20Mbps connection and I'm seeing 42Mbps in my office (~10' away from the eero which is directly connected to my cable modem).  Perhaps I'm too close to the eero but I can't force my PC to connect to a further eero. In any case for the price I paid for this device I should see much faster speeds that 42Mbps. I was getting better speeds on my older Apple airport extreme. That said the interface on the app and the setup were quite simple, I really like the family profiles and based on that I rate this product a 2. But seriously $500 hardware to get such slow speeds is ridiculous.  Performance on the other two devices fluctuates greatly depending a several variables, so overall I'm not happy. I would probably try similar technology offered by several other competitors (Google On-Hub, Linksys Velop or Neatgear's Orbi) all in similar price points and Linksys does offer their tri-band technology which sounds promising! Do your research before you commit to eero.  They may have been first to market, but the competition is steep and getting better.

Title: Pricy, but easy to install and works great
Review Comment: I had so many frustrations with my WiFi reception at home.  Gradually, wireless devices were filling every room of my home and my WiFi signal was weak or absent in many parts of the house.  When I installed 2 nest thermostats I discovered that the signal was too weak in the bedroom.  The ECCO system was expensive, but was so easy to set up and the WiFi is now strong in every corner of my 3,500 sq-ft home.

Title: If you're smart enough to pick eero...
Review Comment: If you're smart enough to pick eero to fix a wifi coverage problem than you get what you deserve, a solution.The brains required to pick eero are also adequate to install and use eero.Wow, using technology to help and not frustrate more... what a great concept and product!Keep up the good work eero and i'll find a differerent problem to fix.Thank you!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works perfect!!!

Title: Dead zones no more
Review Comment: I have a three story townhome which had signal problems regardless of where I moved the router. I enjoy streaming music and video and the eero took care of the dead spots in the house. I bought the three transponder set and LOVE it. Easy set up and away you go.

Title: I bought this system to use our smart TV streaming features
Review Comment: I bought this system to use our smart TV streaming features.  It's important to place the eero within 40 feet of each other to get wifi speeds to stream movies etc.  Once we placed them correctly it works great.  Am glad I purchased and would recommend to others who have issues with streaming or gaming.

Title: excellent Wi-Fi signal for the gamer
Review Comment: Game changer in my house. Because I have a house built in early 1920's all plaster walls with lattes, very difficult time getting a decent Wi-Fi connection in son's second floor bedroom. Eero changed that. 3 units installed,  one next to incoming modem, in hallway and in his room. No buffering, excellent Wi-Fi signal for the gamer, not being yelled at by son that the Wi-Fi signal is for crap, peace and tranquility in house. Added bonus.. I can shutdown his connections and my request to study for finals SOLVED.

Title: Do yourself a favor!
Review Comment: Is it a bit pricey? Yes. Do you want to simplify your Wi-Fi experience  with no more dropped signals., waiting for buffer, other frustrating interruptions in service due to spotty  wi-Fi networking?  Place an order for one of these bad boys today and all your problems are solved. I love spending  Time in my office in around my home again. Especially love no more wires wires wires. I had unboxed and at this  Eero set up in 15 minutes. Very simple even for a novice . I have many devices that connect to my eero, I'll mail running at blazing speed never seen before. I have three laptops,  DirecTV, Amazon fire stick, two iPhones,  and a few other devices that connected with ease. This is the first time I have felt compelled to write a customer review likely because it's the first time I have ever been blown away by a product. Do yourself a favor and simplify your Wi-Fi environment.

Title: This was an excellent buy, solved all my domestic wifi traffic jams
Review Comment: This was an excellent buy, solved all my domestic wifi traffic jams. Very easy to install with logical step by step instructions in one go. Connected it to my home cable router & no additional modifications. It's a simple add on to existing home wifi option. Pricey compared to other options but worth it as its operational 24/7.

Title: FiOS/Sonos/AppleTV incompatibility – sending eero back
Review Comment: Lengthy note follows so I have divided it into 3 sections if you want to skip ahead: (1) the problems I had (1 star); (2) experience with eero Customer Support (4 stars); and (3) implications for other potential buyersThe ProblemsI don’t think I have anything unusually complicated but it is also not a simple set-up.  I have Verizon FiOS, which means we have a single unit for the modem/router.  This also, per the eero website, creates a distinctive wireless environment where the FiOS wireless network shouldn’t be turned off once eero is up and running.  Connected to the wifi network is a collection of devices – computers, cell phones, tablets; some smart thermostats (Nest and Ecobee) and, unfortunately for eero, two Sonos AMP boxes to play music in a couple of our rooms and an AppleTV device.I found the installation process initially stressful but ultimately straightforward and simple.  The initial stress was because after reading about the potential challenges with FiOS I was worried that I wouldn’t be able to figure out how to make it work.  Eero recommended putting the eero in “Bridge” mode and this differs from the step by step instructions they have available so I was concerned I would lose my way in the install.  However, it is very easy, which is what eero told me it would be.  It took about 15 minutes to get the three eero devices connected and functioning, and the mobile eero app was very easy to use.  After I got the eero’s up and running connecting the other devices to the eero network was also straightforward – nothing different than connecting to any other wifi network.  All the computers, iPads, thermostats etc. all found the network and connected without any apparent problems.  Importantly, the eero signal was strong throughout the house, which was the major issue I was trying to solve.However, it was a different story with Sonos and AppleTV. Mysteriously, one of the Sonos boxes would drop out of the eero network after initially being found, and one of the Sonos boxes worked perfectly.  If I rebooted the faulty Sonos box, right after the reset I would see it on the eero network but as soon as I tried to play music, it would drop off.  The AppleTV was similarly mysteriously faulty. I like to use the AppleTV to play music on our home sound system and the music is located on my iPhone.  Prior to eero, this was easy to do – AppleTV recognized my iPhone and the music (and other content) on the phone and would play it.  However, with eero, AppleTV didn’t find the phone.  Oddly, I can use my iPhone in “Airplay” mode to still play music via AppleTV.  In other words I could “push” music from my iPhone to AppleTV but I couldn’t “pull” music using AppleTV from the iPhone.  Figure that one out!Customer Service ExperienceThis experience was positive, despite neither of the problems being solved.  I used email exchanges to communicate with the eero folks – I wanted to make sure they had time to figure out my problem and suggest an appropriate fix and I wanted to be able to try the fix on my own time.  Eero would respond in hours to my emails and their responses were friendly, easy to read and understand and they were not condescending to me, given my lack of technical aptitude.  Alos, every email from eero includes the phone number and hours of operation in case I wanted to call and speak with someone live – how many times have we been to help websites and been unable to find a phone number!  I want to thank Raoul, Isaac, and Hayden for helping try to solve the problems.  However, nothing worked so I am going to pull out the eero network and send it back.Implications for othersReflecting on this situation, I think there are some generalizations to think about if you are considering purchasing eero.  The first is that everyone’s wifi situation is going to be unique and I am sure others are successfully using Sonos and AppleTV with eero. So my problems are mine, and may not be yours.  Second, eero won’t work in all instances.  There is obviously something going on between the eero network and some systems that reside on it.  This is important to think about because I would have thought the eero network was “dumb” – it would capture a wifi signal from a device and pass it on its way without any modification.  However, eero appears to be doing something to the information it picks up – it is trying to be “smart” - and this is where problems will arise.  As I dug deeper into the help section and the eero community blogs I found many instances where eero was interacting in odd ways with devices on the network.  Often the problem would be solved.  There were a number of instances where people had posted that after an eero software update what had been working stopped working.  This needs to be considered as well – because of the way eero has designed its system, it might make a change in the future (or someone like Sonos or Apple might make a change) and your system will go down again.  This is ultimately why I told eero to stop working on my problem – I decided that even if they fixed it (which is a big if) I didn’t want to run the risk that I would have to go through this all over again the next time they released an update.My brother is an engineer at Cisco (how is that for supposedly having an unfair advantage!) and he recommended I try an “access point” since I have Ethernet cable throughout my house. He recommended: TP-Link TL-WA901ND Wireless N450 3TER Access Point, 2.4Ghz 450Mbps, 802.11b/g/n, AP/Client/Bridge/Repeater, 3x 5dBi, Passive POE.  I am going to give these a try but reading the product name makes me nervous – I have no idea what any of this means!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: cleared up our dead zones  - works awesome

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: It simply works, right out of the box.  3300 sq ft house and now full speed wifi everywhere.

Title: Got this system due to terrible performance from a comcast router/modem combo
Review Comment: Got this system due to terrible performance from a comcast router/modem combo. Given my house is a long one story house (slightly over 2k sq ft), a one router system just did not work at all. I have multiple nest cameras and smart home devices that require decent wifi coverage to work adequately. The cameras kept going off the wifi and could not keep a decent connection and I had no connection in the back of the house. My internet speed tested out around an avg of 40Mb/s download speed prior to installing the eero system. It was extremely easy to set up after getting comcast to place my modem in "bridge mode" and shut off the router component of the comcast box. Since installing the eero my speeds are regularly 4x the previous speed (averaging over 160Mb/s) and the cameras have yet to lose connection 3 weeks after installing. This system is awesome and worth the price!!

Title: Amazing product!!!!!
Review Comment: Amazing product!!!!!! Did everything it said it would do when nothing else I tried worked.

Title: Worth the expense!
Review Comment: Works great! Covers our 2100 sq. ft. home and both floors + outside with consistent 115 mb download speed.  Not as easy to install as advertised but tech support made it all happen! Love the the small size & sleek look of the units! Went without power for 17 hours and all 3 units started automatically!  Well worth the expense.

Title: Very cool.
Review Comment: It just works! Great speed and coverage around the house.

Title: I love it!
