Review Comment: I love it!!! I moved and was hating my internet connection at the new place until I got the eero. Now it works flawlessly.

Title: Works as Advertised
Review Comment: Works precisely as advertised.  Very happy with my Eero system.

Title: Great Jeourb!
Review Comment: Works great, very "Joe end-user" friendly, and tech support experience was very positive!

Title: Eero 3-pack (really only needed 2)
Review Comment: It was super easy to set up. I went from getting random top speeds of 40-75 down 15-25 up, to consistently 93+ up and 30-35 up throughout the house. It's a little bit pricey, but if it keeps running like this, it'll be well worth it.

Title: Premium product (and worth it)
Review Comment: Beautifully simple and effective. I'll admit the price tag gave me pause initially, but I was desperate for a solution to inconsistent WiFi throughout my home and constantly buffering Netflix and Hulu. We don't have cable, so streaming quality is important to us. The system came highly recommended by a friend who had similar issues, so I gave it a try. I had tried various routers and range extenders (wired and wireless) in the past, none of which seemed to work as advertised.First, and most importantly, the system works. It created a single, continuous network throughout my home. I don't have to switch networks when I'm on the patio or upstairs and my online and streaming experience is now what I expect it to be. We have phones, tablets, computers, printers, Sonos, Roku, etc. all connected to a single network and it works awesome.The packaging was clean and elegant. The setup could not have been more simple. The iPhone app is incredible. It allows me to monitor the network, see which devices are connected, test download and upload speeds, turn on/off guest access, and more.After several weeks, one of the units wasn't connecting to the network, so I called their support number. It was late on a Sunday evening and I was connected with a polite, English-speaking representative. He tried a few things and in a matter of minutes decided to express ship a new replacement unit instead of keeping me on the line. It was easily one of the best call center experiences I've had.Absolutely no buyer's remorse here. I'm a fan!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Excellent

Title: Fantastic!
Review Comment: Easy setup out of the box. Works like a charm. Loving my eero.

Title: As good as advertised!
Review Comment: I live in a condo complex where my unit has 3 levels, lots of walls and stairs, and about 25 other wireless signals from neighbors. Traditional wifi setup (of a modem/router combo unit on the first floor and a range extender on the second level) just wasn't working. And believe me, I have tried and tried. After years of frustration and spotty signal strength from other products, I decided to go top of the line and order eero (3 pack). Finally, my problems are solved.About 15 minutes after opening the box, eero was updated and broadcasting. I've never had a problem since. My ISP (Comcast unfortunately) provides 75Mbps; every speed test I've run with eero indicates 80+. The handoff of devices from one router to the next is equally impressive. The real kicker is the wall to wall coverage though; signal strength is routinely double that (160+), when before that I felt lucky to get 10.I've used many devices at once; a wired computer, wired DVR, wireless DVR, wireless laptop, two iPads, three smart phones. None of them have ever lost a signal.Expensive yes, but so worth it.

Title: Only modest improvement with one Eero
Review Comment: I have a 932 sq foot home with only one person using, so I purchased a single Eero, per the recommendation on Eero's website and reviews on Amazon.  My internet speed increase and reliability has been, in a word, "meh."  My Eero speed tests consistently report at least 5-8Mbps faster than my three other third-party tests report (Simple Speed, SpeedSpot, AT&T speed test), so I'm not sure what is true.  I have the following devices connected: Macbook, iPhone, Ring doorbell, Sonos, HP printer, Roku.  I have CenturyLink 20Mbps download internet access, which is probably average for people in my income range, neighborhood and usage.  I'm not sure a modest performance improvement was worth $200; while I haven't tested it, I may achieve just as much or more improvement upgrading to CenturyLink 40Mbps download.  I'm sure it is a fantastic device if one has a 2,000+ sq ft home with 2 stories and uses 2-3 Eeros; I have friends who love it.  But I have not experienced a material improvement for a smallish one-story home.In researching the Eero website, blog and support board, even a single Eero is claimed to outperform a home router, though Eero is certainly designed to work best as a system. Performance includes more than just speed - also includes buffering, reliability and reach. Overall, I saw only a small increase in overall performance of my home network with one Eero. Bottom line: if you have a home <1,000 sq feet, a cord-cutter who streams everything, and have only modest disposable income, you are not Eero's target market. Frankly, I'm not sure why Eero even encourages anyone to purchase just one Eero, as clearly it works best as a system of at least 2-3 Eeros to reach all areas of a bigger home. It is disappointing that Eero's customer support is blaming the customer - me - for my simply not understanding.  I will be returning.

Title: Delivered beyond my expectations
Review Comment: I read many reviews about the system and decided to make the investment for family Christmas present.  WOW!! We had been using a router and extender combo.  It was unreliable and had entire family frustrated about functionality.  It took me 20 minutes to set up all 3 units, sign in all devices to the new system and download the app.  It has delivered a consistent and superior experience to previous setup.  My advice to anyone looking at this solution is to buy it.  You will not be disappointed.

Title: Don't wait, just buy it!
Review Comment: I don't know why I waited so long to take the plunge.  Replaced my old wifi+wifi extender setup with 3 eero's and the difference is night and day.  Fast throughput everywhere in the house, and it doesn't just randomly stop working every day or two like the old setup.  Installation was simple and it just worked.  Highly recommended

Title: Set up impossible. No Help
Review Comment: This might be fine if I could get it set up.  Set up requires verification number which I've spent hours trying to get,  Eero doesn't answer help line or respond to email request. Save yourself the trouble and don't buy it.

Title: The Future is Now
Review Comment: I often had a problem getting my entire home covered.  I went through many solutions with multiple routers and extenders but this was the first time I was completely successful eliminating dead spots.  I consider myself technically savvy and I've used some very intricate attempts with varying success but I can guarantee you this, I'm now sold that the future is MESH routing.

Title: Great product.
Review Comment: I had tried three different Wi-Fi devices but always ended up with lack of range and reduced bandwidth of more than 60% from computers on that same system that were hardwired. I heard about “eero” on a podcast ‘Security Now’ that I have listened to for over 11 years and trust. I went to erro.com and review their statement. I bought the Starter WiFi System 2-pack for my 2100 Sq. Ft. single store house. It was easy as they said to setup. I now have a house that gets FULL strength and FULL bandwidth in EVERY part of the house. It has been 6 weeks and I’m still 100% satisfied.

Title: BUYER BEWARE, THE USB PORT IS FOR "DIAGNOSTIC USE" ONLY AND CAN'T BE USE WITH ANY USB DIVICES
Review Comment: READ THIS BEFORE YOU BUY!!! THE USB PORT ON THE DEVICE IS FOR "DIAGNOSTIC PURPOSES" ONLY!! YES, this is no mistake, you cannot plug anything (hard drives, usb printers, etc) into the USB port on the back of the eero device. This is the most dishonest advertising I've ever seen. Great device, but without an ability to plug usb devices into it, it's a $500 paper weight!

Title: Works as advertised!
Review Comment: As I hoped, the eero three pack covers our old(plaster walled) three-story house. We are now able to use Chromecast on the back porch, and dead spots on the third floor are gone. VERY easy to set up.

Title: great product for internet needs hungry for speed
Review Comment: Does exactly what it says it does....consistent high speed internet throughout our home. We live in a 3 level townhouse and prior to installing our eero system we had lags and never attained high speed in the spots furthest away from the original modem. Very helpful and worth every cent.

Title: Delivers everything promised -- and, it was easier to ...
Review Comment: Delivers everything promised -- and, it was easier to set up than advertised.I talked to customer support regarding an issue (turned out that the issue was my doing!) and they were incredibly helpful and supportive.I'd buy one again in a heartbeat. Great whole-home coverage all over our 4200 sq ft home with only the three devices.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: We put up with spotty wifi in our house for years.  Eero gave us outstanding wifi instantly.

Title: Highly Recommend this product if you are looking for fast simple trouble free WiFi.
Review Comment: I had read about these and researched them.  at nearly $500 it was a little more that I wanted to spend. I mean I had WiFi, so what would I really get for my money, would I notice the difference.  I was having trouble Lifx bulbs dropping off WiFi, and having to restart my router every few days, I tried getting a few range extenders to fill the gaps, but the problem persisted and the speed was only 10 mbs or something like that.  So, when I say this go on sale I POUNCED!  every few days now I find myself saying to myself, "I love this WiFi".Changed the way I WiFi.  Blankets my whole 3500 s.f. house with 150MB Wifi.  allows me to connect my Home office computer to a router with a lan cable and get super fast internet, (I could only achieve ~20mb previously).  allows me to connect all my 28 Lifx light bulbs and have NO drop off.  allows me to set up guest network, and I have about 48 devices connected to the WiFi at all times, myself, wife and three adult daughters all streaming video at the same time in different rooms without ever a drop or a buffer.Plus I love the App that lets me monitor all the routers and see the connection speed.

Title: Simple and Effective
Review Comment: Will drastically improve WiFi quality over traditional routers. Easy to setup and manage.

Title: I have ethernet to may rooms so I wanted a system that used ethernet to communicate instead of WiFi and eero seemed like the per
Review Comment: I spent almost a month trying to get them to work with lots of back-and-forth with tech support.  In the end they were returned for a refund.I have a large house (5000 sq ft over 2 floors) with a second pool house (1000 sq ft).  I have ethernet to may rooms so I wanted a system that used ethernet to communicate instead of WiFi and eero seemed like the perfect choice.  Set-up was simple using the app and adding the IP reservations and ports to forward was also simple.  The problem was that the eeros simply would not work as expected and kept dropping connections and, when they would connect, the speed was about 3 Mbps (I get ~120 Mbps from Comcast and via ethernet .  Tech support said it was most likely due to interference (both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands) and that all 6 of my eeros were 'thermal cycling' (slowing the speed to cool off when they got too hot).  I bought an Rf frequency monitor and verified there was no Rf interference on the 5 GHz band unless I was actively using the WiFi connection via a local eero.  They may work well for some, but they did not work for me.  I bought option #2 after returning the eeros (AmpliFi HD) and they have been working well for the last week or so (100+ Mbps via WiFi and no drop outs).  I don't think it was environmental interference that caused issues with the eeros given how well the AmpliFi's work.  I hope eero can solve the issues (or maybe my house is unique, but I doubt it).I was happy with the eero tech support.  We tried a lot of different things over the few weeks but none worked.

Title: So Far So Good.
Review Comment: So far its working great. I did see many people say it worked until it didn't. So far so good, fingers crossed.

Title: Superb Product
Review Comment: Our home is not especially large, but we did have trouble with WiFi when using a "top-of-the-line," conventional wireless router.  With eero, WiFi is as strong in our back yard as it is coming out of the wall.I had read that I could place my old wireless router in "bridge mode" so that it could simply serve as the required cable modem for my eero.  I was a little worried because I'm not very tech savvy, and that sounded like something could easily go wrong.  So I decided to just forget about bridge mode, and run the eero without disabling the WiFi features of my old router.  In our case, the eero works flawlessly alongside the old router.  Less than 15 minutes to get all three up and running.The best thing about our WiFi environment with eero is that it just disappears from our daily thoughts.  We just enjoy as much WiFi as we want, wherever we want.Highest recommendation.

Title: It's a good investment
Review Comment: It was easy to setup.  I have Verizon fios and I did have to call Verizon to recognize my eero.  Once the Verizon rep allowed the device it was smooth sailing. Just saved $120 whoopee!!  I placed the main router in the dining room where my computer is setup temporarily and another in master bedroom.  It did take a abt 12 hours for the bedroom router to start taking on devices.  the main reason I purchased this system is because I was having issue streaming to the bedroom from downstairs the TV kept dropping the connection.  Its still happening after talking to eero and vizio support Vizio is replacing my TV so I will update this after I have the new TV.

Title: This is where it's at.
Review Comment: Dont waste anymore time!  Get this ASAP and save yourself anymore aggravation from a slow/bad connection no matter your area!

Title: Three Stars
Review Comment: way to much for how it works, dissapointed

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: WORKS LIKE MAGIC! set up is 1,2,3!!BUY IT!

Title: The first 3 were extremely easy using the App on my iPhone
Review Comment: This is clearly the easiest and most effective product available for providing WiFi in a larger home.  I actually installed 5 units in a 5000 SF home, but I have seamless Wifi everywhere.  The 4th and 5th units were a bit tricky, since I needed a software update.  The first 3 were extremely easy using the App on my iPhone.  Highly recommend this product for anyone requiring WiFi in a older, larger home (who cannot use hard wiring).

Title: One Star
Review Comment: sent it back.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: easy setup, great customer support, strong/secure wifi all around the house including the yard and the garage.

Title: I Love it! Very easy to use
Review Comment: I Love it! Very easy to use.  I have a 3 level old home and I had 6 wifi extenders previously and it was awful.  Now with eero I have 3 and the wifi is much stronger! I have Sonos, and 2 smart tvs and connection is amazing and never cuts out. Their customer service is great as well

Title: Works as advertised if not better.
Review Comment: Great coverage, ease of setup, ability to monitor remotely and nice packaging.  I bought this for my in-laws who were constantly having connectivity issues and have not had a problem since.

Title: First time wireless speeds fast as wired every inch of house!
Review Comment: We are IT pros and always get latest best wireless tech. So we thought. Only the Eero has delivered high speeds we have never seen before on wired or wireless. Wireless speeds now match the speeds of wired Ethernet AND we are seeing speeds faster in our recorded history! We have 3 units and every inch of our house is covered same high speeds. We were using 3 Linksys routers before - no comparison as the system always works! We should apologize to Comcast thinking it was their fault when internet seemed to go down all the time. IT people? Embarrassing. Notice others now following their lead. Love love love Eero.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Super easy to setup, and lightning fast speeds.  Expensive, but worth it.

Title: So far so good. Our apartment has two bedrooms and the building ...
Review Comment: So far so good.  Our apartment has two bedrooms and the building is pure cement so our signal has improved significantly with Eero.  Easy to install and works very well.

Title: Very pleased
Review Comment: Installed quickly and easily. Worked as promised. Wifi works well all through the house. no more complaints from family members; no more rebooting the router. Loving it.

Title: No complaints from the wife or children about the wifi ...
Review Comment: No complaints from the wife or children about the wifi is priceless!!  10 devices streaming  and still average 125 to 174 mbps.

Title: is the most outstanding wireless home network that I have ever experienced.
Review Comment: eero is the most outstanding wireless home network that I have ever experienced.

Title: Excellent It does what it said it would
Review Comment: Excellent  It does what it said it would do

Title: It works great as advertised
Review Comment: It works great as advertised. I was deciding between orbi vs. eero. Did many research and decided to go with eero due to the fact that it looks great and easy set up. My house is 2600 sq feet and 2 eeros can cover every corner of my house.

Title: Returned and bought Orbi
Review Comment: I just returned my EERO and replaced with orbi. For me, orbi is far and away superior. So much faster and more reliable. I had SIX EEROs that I replaced with THREE Orbis.

Title: Great Product!!
Review Comment: First let me say I do love this product.Was a little difficult to have them connect to start off. We have the main unit in our office which is in the front corner of our house. Master Bedroom is right above the office, but was initially difficult to get the two to pair. Eventually did. Third was in basement, again not to far away, to a couple tries, and eventually paired.  Once they were paired, I did move the 2nd and 3rd unit about 10-15 ft further, and they stayed connected.  Interface in app is very user friendly, and the steps for setup was easy to understand. My favorite thing is being able to see everyone on our internet connection. as well as now having a strong signal throughout the house.

Title: Life changer
Review Comment: Eero works great and improved my life. I was so frustrated with my home internet service that I would run to the office frequently. Not any more. What a difference. Easy to set up, Eero eliminates dead spots and provides internet access evenly throughout the house. Highly recommended!

Title: Easy to set up
Review Comment: Endless buffering is a thing of the past.  Easy to set up, unobtrusive (if not elegant) in the morass of exposed tech items, and very helpful tech support. I had been planning to switch to FIOS, but now I'm less inclined since my systems are working so well.

Title: He said he had never seen better coverage and speeds that we were getting throughout out ...
Review Comment: I first bought the newest NightHawk.  It was not able to reach all the areas in the house.  Local computer company that I used was dubious about the eero system and wanted to get a repeater.  I read the reviews, ordered the eero system.  The coverage was unbelievable.  Achieved not just coverage but speeds beyond expectations.  Returned the Nighthawk.  The Computer Tech that came over to help me install the EERO was blown away.  He said he had never seen better coverage and speeds that we were getting throughout out home with eero.  He is now recommending eero when he goes out to customers.  EERO -- great product, easy to install .. and performance beyond expectations.

Title: Absolutely works as advertised
Review Comment: If you can insert a plug into an outlet on the wall and tap a couple of buttons on a smartphone, you can absolutely install eero. Previously we had very unreliable performance when trying to stream movies and my wife would often lose the wifi connection on her iPad when changing locations in our home. Now that we have the eero devices installed, those problems have gone away. I had tried a wifi extender previously but that had offered only a marginal improvement. The eeros have solved the problem for us.

Title: My 3500 square foot home was a wifi nightmare. ...
Review Comment: My 3500 square foot home was a wifi nightmare.  My 16 year daughter was constantly whining about the wifi in her room at the far end of the house from my old wifi router.  With eero my daughter doesn't complain.  Peace reigns (at long last) in the house.

Title: Easy setup. awesome coverage
Review Comment: Easy setup.awesome coverage. I replaced 3 apple routers

Title: So much better than traditional extenders!
Review Comment: We were on the verge of buying another netgear extender for $100 until I heard a blurb on NPR from a reporter talking about ideal Christmas gifts.  The NPR reporter mentioned the eero as her ideal wish list item.  After a bit of research and understanding how eero technology is much more effective at extending wi-fi versus traditional extenders, I decided to purchase the eero two-pack for our two-story, 1,900 sqft home.  The result:  we now get steady wi-fi in our second story back office versus before we had a netgear extender which could not reach the office.  After a month of enjoying the two-pack eero, we got greedy and purchased a third eero unit to amp up wi-fi speed in the upstairs office.  The third unit is the cherry and we are super happy with being able to use our upstairs office instead of camping out in the living room close to the router.ALSO a side note - when deactivating the router function in our internet service provider's modem and activating the eero router function, I reached out to Spectrum/Time Warner for help. Big kudos to Spectrum/Time Warner for already having knowledge on how to redirect the router from the Spectrum modem to the eero device.

Title: I like it when everything works!
Review Comment: Eero has met or exceeded my expectations! I no longer experience the freezing of my network.  The devices have to be managed if there is a change made to the network. No worries - I was able to call the customer service number - spoke with Jared who discovered I had a network outage which resolved while we were on the phone. I think it is so worth it to have a set of (3) so each area of my home has a strong connection. I have (9) devices connected to my network and everything works consistently and seamlessly! Go figure!Thanks

Title: Good solution for a difficult house
Review Comment: Happy with the result. My prior solution was a powerline network which distributed wifi through the house with 3 separate routers and separate networks. With the powerline approach and 100 download megabits into the house I ended up with only 15-25 megabits at the end points. Now I am getting a consistent 50 to 75 megabits through the entire house without the hassle of hunting for the best network. Especially important for Ultra HD video streaming and fast file downloads. Good job EERO!

Title: This is a great product and very easy to setup
Review Comment: We have a large 2 story home and the eero is the answer to our wifi problems. This is a great product and very easy to setup.

Title: Steep price tag, but worth it for us.
Review Comment: It's a steep price tag, no doubt, but there's no substitute for just flat-out working well. This was a breeze to set up (less than 5 minutes) and beats the pants off of any other router we've ever tried when it comes to range. Pricey product, but zero buyer's remorse here.

Title: It just works, finally the solution I have been looking for....
Review Comment: Absolutely the easiest and best networking solution I have ever tried. Easy setup and wonderful telephone support - patient and very helpful. Even called back to see that I was doing well. Finally the wifi solution I have been looking for. No more trial and error, it just works!

Title: Unbelievable that in 2016/2017 we still have network devices which ...
Review Comment: Unbelievable that in 2016/2017 we still have network devices which only work on US market. Need US phone for setup and works only with 120V.  :(And of course I learned this after ordered 6 pieces. My fault I should read install guide and requirements before.

Title: Problem solved
Review Comment: Eero solved our wirelesss trouble.  We have a basement that we could never get a good signal in.  Now the boys can play their XBox with friends and everyone's phones can be connected.  While my wife is upstairs watching Netflix in any part of our house and I'm in the office/den working on my computer(streaming a game).

Title: We've had this in our home now for the last ...
Review Comment: We've had this in our home now for the last month. Been extremely impressed with the mesh network. Download speeds are fast (250-450mbps) uploads(125-200mbps). All cameras Nest and Ring show significant performance improvement. No more jitter or lag

Title: This is a home run!
Review Comment: I find this to be a great product. While I am not a system engineer, I am slightly 'techie' and was in need of a new router and this was recommended to me by my son. I did the research and felt this would meet my needs. My two previous routers never delivered the speed or the coverage, in fact one was 2 months old and I was very upset with the 'over promise and under deliver'. The EERO has been an absolute winner from the minute I installed it.The setup was very easy. I did need to call support and it was very helpful and I was up and running in 30 minutes. The speed is fantastic and I have double the coverage from previous. I just can't imagine how it could be easier or better than the experience I have had so far.

Title: Easy to setup
Review Comment: It works great and was really simple to setup.

Title: Easy to Use/Setup
Review Comment: Great wifi system and very easy to use/setup

Title: Replaced three Linksys extenders... now I can ...
Review Comment: Replaced three Linksys extenders ...now I can walk anywhere in the house and my IPad doesn't drop signals and stays on the whole home Eero system.

Title: The EERO System Is Working Excellent For My Financial Firm!
Review Comment: I installed this system in my small office approximately three weeks ago.  We have 15 devices connecting to them wirelessly.  So far, they have worked flawlessly.  They are incredibly easy to setup using the free mobile app.  They offer superb bandwidth via WiFi and seem to really do well at not dropping connections.  I have absolutely zero complaints so far.  As well, the range for each module is very impressive.  We can easily go 100 ft in any direction and have excellent signal.My one favorite feature about the EERO system compared to several other similar systems I was looking at, is that each module has two ethernet ports on that back that allow two things to be available: 1) I can hardwire devices at my office(that do not have wifi option) to these via ethernet cable, and 2) I can hardwire the modules via ethernet back to the main unit serving as the router which provides a more robust setup with a much less chance of dropouts.I will definitely recommend these to other for their small offices and homes. These are fantastic!

Title: Parental Controls Very Disappointing
Review Comment: I am an IT Director by day, but don't love doing complex network setups at home. Eero setup was super easy and worked well with my ISP's router (I have TDS Telecomm Fiber). I don't have any issues with the networking or the UI.However, the parental controls - which were a primary reason for choosing Eero over some of its competitors- are really disappointing. Here's what you can for family controls: organize your devices into profiles by family member, schedule them for down time (per specific hours), and live pause them if needed. That's it.So far, I haven't seen any logs of where my kids are going, any ability to block sites, nor the ability to set time limits to X hours per day.I may return this and try the Luma ...

Title: Really fast & easy setup! Made a deep research considering Eero
Review Comment: Really fast & easy setup! Made a deep research considering Eero, Orbi, Unify and waiting for Google Wifi, but after all decide for eero since it has easy to use platform, mesh using wired ethernet as backbone and also really low profile device (unify has those huge antennas, Orbi are quite big)... Google Wifi was my second in list, but since wasnt able to buy i didnt want to wait longer and took it.Eero is really worth it device!!Only their speed test system is not as good as one speedtest.net ... sometimes Eero test shows really low speed. i have 100/25mbps but it shows 67/7mbps (when i download osmething goes really to 100mbps!), which is not really a downside.I only miss option to work with OpenVPN, but i hope they add it soon.

Title: Finally my WIFI issues are solved.
Review Comment: Absolutely amazed at how this transformed my life. No longer do I have to hear complaints from the family about how they are not getting a signal. Now, not only a signal, but a strong one. Easily tripled the speed, and in fact, I actually am getting a higher speed in some rooms that I am paying for.I was a little skeptical about how easy the setup was after reading most of the reviews. I was preparing for a rough afternoon of banging my head against the wall dealing with setup. I asked my wife to run to the store to pick up a 6 pack of beer to make the process less painful.... Believe it or not, I actually had the entire eero setup before she got home. I set up 4 units in my home and have completely trouble free WIFI now.

Title: Easy to set up
Review Comment: Easy to set up. Great coverage all over the house. Too bad you need to spend this much to make xfinity work!

Title: Amazing wireless routers
Review Comment: Eero has changed the way I use wireless at my home.  From the quick and painless set up process to the consistent speeds in every corner in my home.

Title: 3 EEROs isn't necessarily better than 2 old Airports, just different
Review Comment: We bought these to replace our aging Apple Airport Extremes (not the latest version, but the one before they went to the small towers). We've had great experience with our Airports, but had a "dead zone" in the front of our house. Our house has a living space shaped like an capital L. The main Airport was upstairs in the "elbow" of the L shape(within 30 feet of both the upstairs and downstairs Wired Eeros). The second one was downstairs at the end of the L hard wired to the one upstairs. This left a bit of a weak zone on the other end of the L.We placed two of the Eero's in place of the Airports. The third one we place downstairs in the downstairs elbow connected wirelessly. This fixed our weak zone in the front, however our performance in the back yard has been disminished. So our gain in the front made our back yard a weak zone. We spend more time in our back yard which is a loss for us with our new network. I expected more based on all the reviews and the fact we have 3 devices instead of just two.

Title: Works great!
Review Comment: Wifi magic!  Years of Comcast spotty Internet.  Hears about this.  Easiest thing ever!  Harder to change batteries in a flashlight.  Works great!

Title: eero is a great upgrade.
Review Comment: The eero (3 pak) completely changed my entire network for the better! Setup was very easy, with no problems at the time. I replaced an Apple AirPort Extreme base station with 3 Apple AirPort Express devices used to extend my network as as AirPlay nodes. The old network worked OK, but I had to restart routers occasionally because of occasional buffering glitches with Netflix, Tablo, Plex, and Sling TV on my Apple TV. It was easy to set up the eero and then join my AirPort Express / AirPlay devices to the new network. I also have a switch counted to the primary office eero, and have had no issues connecting several devices (printer, network drives, iMac. Tablo) via ethernet. I did have one issue with an eero software upgrade, but that was resolved easily by eero support. Now, my speed test shows 148 mbps download and 13 mbps upload speeds. Fantastic!

Title: I personally believe for best results each eero needs to be physically connected to ...
Review Comment: If you have a large home spread out or a home with multiple levels this is a must have product.  I replaced my aging NetGear AP that just could not handle the data and traffic being thrown at it.  I personally believe for best results each eero needs to be physically connected to the network.  When setting mine up the devices initially complained about not being near one another.  Not sure what good that does for you, but once connected physically to my telco closet they worked like a champ!!!  The app to control these is easy to setup and use.  New product features are being added frequently as they are taking user feedback seriously.  Highly recommend these!

Title: All the grandkids can be on their devices and our office still have fun coverage. I highly recommend this system for your ...
Review Comment: Our office is above our garage.  eero covers our entire house and office. We used to have spotty coverage in the back bedroom where our grandson used his xbox, now there is full coverage in this room, no game interruptions. All the grandkids can be on their devices and our office still have fun coverage.  I highly recommend this system for your home and office.

Title: Not Worth the $500
Review Comment: I was excited about this product but this product because ut was the first wifi system in the market turns out this is rubbish we extremely slow speeds and only one ethernet port this is just not for alot if people  I would highly recommend the netgear orbi over this

Title: This WiFi system has been fantastic. Great coverage throughout my entire home (3 floors)
Review Comment: This WiFi system has been fantastic.  Great coverage throughout my entire home (3 floors).

Title: I love it!
Review Comment: I love it and have returned my wifi extenders and power line adapters. It does what they said it does.  I only wish it had a firewall that you could blacklist web sites.

Title: Now if only a better connection than the 5Mb/s were to come to their ...
Review Comment: It really made a difference at my parents' house. From basement to ground floor, mezzanine and second floor, reception is now everywhere. Some of the signal was enough to even reach my grandpa's house next door! Now if only a better connection than the 5Mb/s were to come to their community, that would really make things ideal!

Title: Good idea, performance issues, could be bad for gaming
Review Comment: ---- Edit 2/20/2017 ----I will say eero Customer Service has been awesome.  But, after two replacement eeros I am still  having problems as outlined below.  I am at the point, I have disconnected the closest node to my laptop so I only connect to the gateway node to minimize drops.  I still have drops on the gateway node (via ping test described below) but not as frequent, though they seem to occur at bad times (e.g., watching a vid or playing a game).  Not sure what to do next.Also, today, I have and issue where the eero iPhone app displays that there is a internet connectivity issue and the Gateway eero is offline.  YET, I can still connect to the internet through the laptop and other devices [scratches head].  CS told me to reboot the eeros AGAIN to see if it fixes the problem  At this point, I am afraid to touch anything when things are working so I told them I would wait till there is a problem (I run a significant internet based home business) or I can afford to be down.I am still hoping things get worked out and stabilized a little more, but will probably picking up a backup router just in case. I will update this review again as things progress.----- Original Review ----Be careful if you game or periodic dropped connections will cause problems.  I have 3 of these and all of them are on one floor within 50' of each other.  After installing, I started constantly seeing internet lag and dropped connections.  My son, playing games, kept getting booted out of games because of the dropped connections.So, I decided to do a little Ping test.  The eero that was connected to the cable modem was x.x.x.1, and the eero that was in the family room was x.x.x.27.  My laptop was wireless connected to x.x.x.27.  By nature of the mesh network, my laptop path to the internet should simplistically be:Laptop ==> x.x.x.27 ==> x.x.x.1 ==> Cable Modem ==> InternetTo monitor the connection I opened a 3 DOS Command windows, with each window running one of the following ping commands:1) ping -t x.x.x.12) ping -t x.x.x.273) ping -t 8.8.8.8 (Google DNS Server [internet])The -t option keeps the ping test running constantly so I could monitor the connections.  It turns out the ping to x.x.x.27 stayed pretty steady, while the ping to x.x.x.1 kept timing out.  This led me to believe that the connectivity between x.x.x.27 and x.x.x.1 was the problem.  So I disconnected power from x.x.x.27 which forced my laptop to connecto to x.x.x.1... GUESS WHAT?The problem went away!I plugged the family room eero back in and the problem returned.  I switched eeros with the third (by the entry way) and the problem still existed.  I factory reset the eero and re-added back to the network and the problem still exists.So this leads me to believe there is a problem with their mesh implementation and/or possible interference rejection between the nodes.I NEVER had a dropped connection with my previous Linksys router. The only reason I replaced it was because I dropped it while rearranging the office and broke off the anntennae. I have some pretty good experience working with secure mesh networks and understand the benefits so I thought  I would give this commercial technology a try......IMHO, they will get there, but there is still several bugs and performance issues to be worked out.Note:Hopefully I explained the above simply enough for others to try the test and see what performance you are getting.  You can find the IP addresses to use in the eero app by clicking on nodes at the bottom of the My Network page.  Click the number next to Number of Devices on that page to get a list of all the devices connected to the network, look for the computer you are running the ping test on to see what eero your compter is connected to.

Title: Amazing product!!
Review Comment: I usually don't write reviews but this product is just amazing,  with only one device I was able to cover my entire house,  I am pretty sure I won't need to buy a second one.  I was a bit hesitant about the rf performance because there is no external antennas but obviously they did a great job with the internal ones.The set-up is super easy and the app does a great job simplifying the configuration.The product I replaced with eero was a netgear n600.Totally recommended this product to anyone with poor wifi coverage at home.

Title: It makes me sad to have to post such a mediocre review - ...
Review Comment: It makes me sad to have to post such a mediocre review - there are a lot of things Eero does well, and I really wanted to keep this product, but in the end it didn't work for my situation. In short, I just switched from Uverse to Spectrum, and as part of the change, I bought my own modem, the Arris Surfboard SB6183 (https://www.amazon.com/ARRIS-SURFboard-SB6183-DOCSIS-Cable/dp/B00MA5U1FW) based on the recommended supported modems from Spectrum and the excellent reviews on the Surfboard. Cable guy came and set me up, the modem worked perfectly and I was pulling down 117 mb/s on ethernet.I opened up the Eero and set up the primary -- set up was a piece of cake, you just download the app on your phone and follow the instructions. It was working within a couple minutes, and I was getting full speed over wifi standing right in front of the primary. I tested the speeds around our place (we have 1 level, 3 bedrooms) - in the furthest bedroom from the primary Eero I was getting about 33 mb/s. Not bad, considering that it was a deadzone with my previous setup. I plugged in the 2nd Eero in the hallway outside the furthest bedroom, and it found the primary and set up without a problem. Afterwards, I was getting about 77 mb/s down in that far bedroom. Pretty good!So I was happy, I moved all our wifi devices onto the network and figured I had solved internet in our place once and for all.Well, the next day I bought a new phone (big holiday week for tech!). I brought my phone home and restored from my computer backup and started downloading all my apps from the Apple app store. Only... some of them weren't downloading. I figured it was some kind of bottleneck due to the large number of apps I was downloading at the same time, and let it go for the evening. The next morning, about half of my apps were done, and the other half were just missing. Hmm. So I jumped onto the App Store and started downloading the missing apps one by one. And here's when I noticed the problem. Some of them downloaded without a problem, but some of them just would not finish! It would start, get about 30%, or 50%, or 75% done downloading, and then I would get a dialog that said "This app cannot be downloaded at this time. Retry/Cancel?" And I would retry, and it would start downloading, and I would get the same dialog. Over and over. Now, the part that made it really frustrating was that sometimes.. if you persisted long enough.. it would actually finish. And so I spent the next 3 days, tip tapping away at this dialog, retry, retry, retry, hoping to finish all my app downloads.Was it the new ISP? Was it the new modem? Was it the new Eero? Was it the App Store? Unfortunately I had so many variables, I wasn't sure where to start or who to call first. So I tried another network. I turned off Wifi and tried downloading the trouble apps on LTE - and they downloaded instantly. Ok - so it was network.I jumped on my computer, also connected to the network, and tried downloading some apps directly from iTunes. Similar situation -- apps would start downloading, and then I would get "Error 3253", which is a generic "download interrupted, check your network connection" type error.So it was the network, and it was specifically the Apple stores that I was having a problem with. No issues with any other source of content - Netflix, Hulu, all my streaming media was working just fine. I spent a lot of time googling the issue, and couldn't find anything specifically resembling my symptoms - I did see that there were some reported problems between the Arris SB6183 modem and the Eeros, when the Arris had a specific version of firmware. However, my Arris did not have that firmware version. My Arris is on D30CM-OSPREY-1.5.2.3-GA-01-NOSH, where the problem firmware was SB6183-9.2.0.0-GA-03-29-NOSH.So next step was to switch out the Eero and then the modem, and see what specifically was causing the issue. I started with the Eero - I bought a new router, the TP-Link Archer C7 (v2) as recommended by Wirecutter. Unplugged Eero, setup of the Archer (which is a hideous black thing with 3 antennas and a real light show of green LEDs that CANNOT  be turned off). Set up was easy, I spun up a wifi network and tried downloading one of the troublesome apps -- and it downloaded with no problem, and very quickly. I tried a few more apps, on my phone and my computer, and everything downloaded quickly without issue. Sigh. So it was the Eeros.I tested the speed of the Archer around my place to see if maybe I wanted to hook up the Eeros in bridge mode alongside the Archer. In the furthest bedroom, where I was getting 77 mb/s before with the Eeros, I was able to get 100 mb/s with the Archer. Wow. I guess those hideous antennas are doing something right. Sigh again. So I didn't need the Eeros at all, our place was small enough (around 1300 sq ft) that the 1 Archer was able to handle the job.So, I packed up the Eeros and sent them back today. As I said, I was very sad to do so -- the Eeros are aesthetically lovely, and the app is too. I hate looking at the Archer, and I need to buy some black tape to cover up the laser show of LEDs. But for whatever reason, the Eeros just weren't working with the largest content provider in my life, and thats a deal breaker.

Title: Delivered full coverage for my 3 story house
Review Comment: I had the Luma system and was not getting full coverage in my house. The Eero delivered with great coverage in a difficult building on all three floors!

Title: Wifi for the whole house
Review Comment: I saw this recommended by Consumers Report for holiday gifts. It is very easy to install. It did take longer than advertised, but it was easy. I have three of the devices since I have a two story house. I can now get fast wifi all over my house and stream the videos on my smart TV. It is one of my favorite purchases of 2016.

Title: After some extremely minimal networking setup via their smart phone app
Review Comment: After some extremely minimal networking setup via their smart phone app, I've been up and running with no issues for the past 2 months!Our units are configured between two physical floors, and they work great!Bonus that support was very friendly and helpful and very responsive (30 minutes) email support

Title: Awesome WiFi everywhere
Review Comment: This is the most incredible router ever.  I previously used and still use an Apple Airport Extreme which could not make it to my bedroom on the other side of the house.  Now I am able to blanket my entire home with reliable WiFi that is full strength in nearly every square inch of my home including my yard outside.  In regards to the Airport Extreme, I am still able to use Apple's time machine through EERO's system connected to the Airport but with the Airport's WiFi turned off as to not interfere with the EERO WiFi.  EERO has instructions on their website on how to set up the Airport Extreme to continue using Apple's Time Machine.  I was skeptical about this Mesh WiFi concept but the EERO is the real deal.  Do not hesitate to purchase if you have WiFi problems at your home.

Title: No More Resetting Signal!!!
Review Comment: 5 years ago I moved from a 1300 sqft home to a 3300 sqft home. And for 5 years I have struggled to get consistent, high quality coverage throughout our space.I have spent at least $300 in modems, wifi routers and extenders, not to mention hours...sometimes the better part of an entire day setting a network up, only to find equipment isn't compatible and I need to start over.We had made due with one extender that needed to be reset about 3x week.When I heard about Eero I was excited, maybe my evenings of crawling out of bed in the middle of a show to reset the signal were over.They ARE!!! Eero is as amazing as I heard it was!!!I set the whole system (I bought the 3 pack) up in about 30 minutes- that includes time spent reading the instructions.We have a network, a personalized password that makes sense...not the weird random series of characters everyone hates but beginners don't know how to change...(For reference, I don't consider myself a beginner in this work, I am tech savvy and able to work my way through networks and systems, however setting up multiple different extenders on one network proved difficult for me. We had personalized network password before eero).I can control everything from my phone...not much to control but I can see how many devices are on the signal, turn the device lights off/on, and see the speeds I'm uploading/downloading at.Also, the diagram says to centralize all the hubs, but due to the odd layout of our house it just wasn't possible. Even without the centralizing we have full signal in every room, including our garages and backyard. We basically cover 1/2 an acre!!! It's not full strength all over, but it's covers the space!We have been up and running solidly for a month now...no issues!The CONS-*I know I should list $$$, however I think the quality of the devices compared to the cost I've spent trying to get what this delivers is fairly comparable...I'd much rather spend the money once on one functional product than little bits at a time trying to make something work that just doesn't ever get there.*Ethernet outlets are limited. This isn't a huge deal, but our printer is outdated and we needed a way to connect it. Updating printer now.

Title: Absolutely Fantastic!!!!!
Review Comment: The Eero system is absolutely fantastic!  Set-up is silly-easy and the coverage is awesome.  What I really liked was the first time we had a FaceTime conversation with our son from overseas.  Before we'd have freezing, dropped calls....more headache than anything.  The first time we made a call using the Eero system there were no hiccups, no freezing, no dropped calls; it was wonderful.I would not hesitate recommending these to anyone.  A little pricey, but absolutely worth it!

Title: Great product. Easy to set up and works as ...
Review Comment: Great product.  Easy to set up and works as advertized.

Title: FABULOUS!!!
Review Comment: Fabulous. SO easy to set up!  I've tried 3 other types of "systems", all with extremely disappointing results.  I have internet where I've never had it before and I couldn't be happier.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Setup was easy and has provided solid Wifi throughout house for last 8 months.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Easy to use setup and use.

Title: EERO delivers on its promise of easy connectivity
Review Comment: Buy a eero and solve your wifi issues forever. This product is great, set up Is easy and connects one to the internet at the drop of a hat. No more does one have to mimic the old Verizon ad - " can you hear me now".Eero has made it simple, easy and fun to install a wifi network. The  app works well, its usage information and other details make it the best product in the market. Bottom line is that it works as advertised and has taken the pain out installing wifi networks anywhere. All other competitor products may have high ratings but this one tops them all.If you are shopping for wifi router buyntgis product without hesitation.

Title: I tried everything, this is the best on the market right now.
Review Comment: I have many years of experience with frustrating routers, devices and service providers. Over the years I've encountered nearly every problem known to man around residential internet and wireless networks. If you value having reliable connectivity and have at least six wireless devices then you should totally make the investment in the Eero device.I also really like having admin control over my devices via the mobile app. The app allows you to boot any device and group them so you know exactly which device is connected and how they contribute to the bandwidth load on your network. Also some really clean features for managing temporary guest networks. I have a vertical layout townhouse, 2,000 sq ft with four floors between the basement and roof terrace. I installed my Eero 3 pack wired via ethernet but I found that even the two pack was very effective. I have 100mbps service with 14 connected devices (5 of which are wired using a gigabit switch).

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: It works great.

Title: Eero is easy, elegant, and robust wifi!
Review Comment: We are an all Apple household ( two iMacs, two MacBooks, four iPhones, and two Apple TVs) and, honestly, an Apple Time Capsule with AirPort Express expanders just weren't cutting it!  Apple also recently announced that they're getting out of the Wi-Fi business so I started looking for an alternative.The eero mesh network is something that Steve Jobs and Johnny Ives could have made!  Each unit is beautifully self-contained and attractive.  Looks are important!  I have four of them in my house. Where I would have a network problem every other day with my Apple equipment I've had none since installing the eeros more than a month ago.Set up is done via the eero app on my iPhone. The app is elegant and super user friendly. I enjoy checking in on my network remotely from work! Updates happen automatically in the background.I didn't worry too much about the cost since I'm going to have these and enjoy them for several years.  You get what you pay for.  It's the same reason I buy Apple products.I can't think of too many negatives. Would be awesome if they also came in black!  Perhaps one of them could come with a few more ethernet ports. All I did was buy a dumb five port ethernet box and I was able to plug and my Apple TV, etc.I've already recommended these to my family and friends. Easily the best purchase I made last year!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Love EERO have been frustrated with other wifi products. EERO is very easy to set up and works beautifully.

Title: Eero system does as intended; increases signal strength where once deficient
Review Comment: As with most, if not all, customers, we purchased the Eero system to increase our internet signal strength throughout our home.  The installation was relatively simple and the signal strength has increased dramatically in several areas where it was non-existent before.  I'll probably purchase one more as I'd like to get a stronger signal in my garage.I would recommend this product and I have to several of my friends and colleagues.

Title: Awesome product. Read about it in the WSJ
Review Comment: Awesome product.  Read about it in the WSJ.  Had severe issues in home regarding wifi range and streaming TV.  Works beautifully and easy to install!  Already recommended to other folks.  I do, however, need to add one more.  Two story home with 2800 sq feet.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: It magically solved the streaming issues in my house.  I am not sure how, but it works.

Title: Eero improved Fios Wifi throughout 3-level home
Review Comment: My three-story home with one Verizon Fios router has several dead zones. Fios wifi gets worse and worse in my home each year. I am glad I got Eero and that it works. On the second floor (main level), one dead zone is completely gone and the other is greatly improved. On the third level of the home wifi speeds are fast! ...and the Fios router is in the basement (lst level). Download speeds are super quick as compared to Fios wifi.

Title: Excellent Product, Worth the Cost
Review Comment: The set-up is incredibly easy and the system is very effective.  We live in a narrow, four-level row house that was getting horrible wifi coverage in most of the space despite multiple boosters.  Eero has full power wifi blasting to every corner of our house now.  It is a night and day improvement.  It's costly, but I'd recommend this product to anyone.

Title: Blanket your home in wifi with Eero!
Review Comment: Best wifi system EVER!!!  I have tried several wifi extenders, but none were able to extend my wifi to my basement.  With the Eero 3-pack I am now able to get 5 bars in my basement while the router is still on the main floor.  Eero is costly, but worth every penny!

Title: Coverage is disappointing.
Review Comment: Honestly, was very excited for mesh technology for the consumer, but for my 900 square ft apartment, 2 eeros only cover the living room, and no bedrooms get coverage.  With a single OnHub I had full living room, 1 bedroom, and half the 2nd bedroom.I'm sure I could get full coverage if I bought 2 more Eero, but I might as well just run cable to every single room of my apartment.Setup was fine, but without coverage it's pointless.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: I installed in my house (3  pack) and it covers the whole house and backyard with ease.

Title: I love the eero systems.
Review Comment: I love the eero system.  I set one up for myself and one at my sister's house.  It took less than 10 minutes to get all the units up and running at my sister's house.  And the speed, I can't say enough good things about that.  We had slow sketchy coverage before, even with a range extender.  I couldn't believe how easy this was.  Amazing.I did have some trouble at my home but it had nothing to do with the eeros.  They found everything on my network. I just had some trouble with my other devices but all is good and I'm continuously pleased with the system. I highly recommend the eero Home WiFi System.

Title: for TV so it was important that all rooms in the house had great signal strength
Review Comment: This did exactly what was promised.  I moved into a large 3 floor townhouse and was worried about signal strength throughout the house.  I only stream hulu etc. for TV so it was important that all rooms in the house had great signal strength.  Easy to follow directions made it easy to start.  I had to call customer service because one unit was not immediately active.  Customer service was excellent, answered in seconds, was actually able to find my network and reset the device remotely.  Wow...plus the agent was super nice and stayed on the line as I connected the last device.  I was up and running in 15 minutes.

Title: but the install instructions tell you that they pretty much need to be in line of sight of ...
Review Comment: Going to have to buy another one or two as the three did not cover my home. Not really mentioned in the description, but the install instructions tell you that they pretty much need to be in line of sight of each other. My modem/router is in the garage (Good old Verizon FIOS installers) with 2-3 walls to get into the house and also have an upstairs with both a ceiling and a floor to get the signal through. Can't shoot it up the stairs as stairs have a landing and a 180 degree bend. Solved the upstairs problem by hooking the first one upstairs directly to the modem in the garage via a previously self installed Ethernet cable. Still thinking about the downstairs problem.  If anyone has any suggestions would appreciate them.

Title: Awesome product that beats many commercial systems that are six times the price.
Review Comment: This is by far the best Mesh Wi-Fi system I've ever seen especially for personal use -especially at this price. I replaced four WiFi access points from Netgear throughout my home in a matter of 20 minutes using the eero system. The three access points seemlessly cover my entire place after I configured them wired and in bridge mode. I couldn't be more pleased with this product.

Title: Great upgrade in signal strength and WiFi speeds!
Review Comment: We have an older, 3000 sq ft house and had dead zones and performance problems with my old Airport Extreme router.  Decided to take the plung to this one for better coverage (I also wanted to reach our outdoor kitchen area where we sometimes set up a Fire TV stick and projector to watch a movie).  I'm not sure if it is the bump to AC or the mesh network, but the 3 eero devices have been amazing. Looking forward to being able to turn off my kid's wifi via Echo as well.I would give it 5 stars, except for 2 minor things:1. Manual parental controls are great (scheduling no internet times, turning off internet on demand), but I'd love for more granular control in the form of a couple of new features. First, some basic content filtering.  My kids are getting older, and I'd love some simple filtering to prevent them from getting to known bad sites. Second, maybe allow time limits (not time of day, but limiting active internet use to 2 hours, for example). This would be harder, because iPads / iPhones are always in the background doing something on the network, so determining "active" usage could be challenging.2. I cannot seem to get the port forwarding working. I have a Synology NAS running a web server with a wordpress blog, and I cannot seem to get it to allow the connection through.  Need to follow up with support, but the WiFi has been so great, I actually am OK with my web server being inaccessible in the meantime!Edit: I just got a response from eero support about the port forwarding.  So it seems that the port forwarding is working fine, but the eero does not support hairpin NAT / NAT loopback, which means I can't access my internal servers through the external domain / IP.  Not a huge issue, since internally I can simply access the server via my internal IP.  When I access my domain on any other network, it works fine. So, while it's still not fully resolved, they did get back to me in 2 days and provided an answer to why I though it wasn't working.

Title: Now I show complete coverage and good signal strength BUT I have trouble connecting to the ...
Review Comment: I have installed the system in the house which was a challenge as my modem is in the garage and when I place the first one next to it and the second one in the house about 35 feet away they would not connect, it was just one wall and 35 feet but seem to be too much for the device. Ended up having to run cable and move cable modem into the house to get the three eeros to connect to each other.Now  I show complete coverage and good signal strength  BUT I have trouble connecting to the internet thru the system when multiple devices are in use . If we are watching Netfix in living room and I want to connect with my IPad in the living room the Ipad will not find the internet. It shows good signal strength but will not connect. Same with my home computer, the kids are watching Netflix in the living room but my computer in the bedroom  cannot connect to internet, had to log on to the old wireless system so I could get on line. I was using a Motorola Surfboard and Almond range extender before I bought the EERO and the Almond had its own trouble staying connected and thought the Eero was the answer but it was not. For the price paid I do not feel I got my moneys worth

Title: Best christmas gift
Review Comment: Our Internet signal was so weak and constantly frustrating. Getting the three port Eero has more than solved that problem. I have never written a review. But this has been beyond expectations and want to applaud the  people who market this product. Thank you. --  RKZ

Title: I a good signal everywhere in my house no
Review Comment: I've been trying many different WiFi solutions over the years. I've tried installing custom firmware on them. Nothing seems to give me what I've looking for. I got the eero because it's supposed to solve the issues I'm running into; which is not getting signal throughout my entire house. The eero has far surpassed my expectations. I a good signal everywhere in my house no, and no connection losses. The speed is really fast everywhere too. Their customer support has been amazing also.

Title: best home WiFi available today!
Review Comment: Incredible product, hands down. easy setup, solid coverage, seemless hand-off, one SSID, adding my Synology NAS was a piece of cake, fantastic network management right on my smartphone.

Title: Works perfect - solved my problem!
Review Comment: We have a 3,500 sq ft home. The office and wireless router was on the main floor all the way on the left side of the house and the media room is upstairs all the way on the right side of the house. It took a long time to load Netflix and often stopped while watching to continue loading.We purchased a 3 pack of Eeros.It only took my 5 minutes to set it up with my iPhone. One in the office, one at the bottom of the stairs and one at the top of the stairs. Everything now loads almost instantly and it never stops while watching (streaming 4K).

Title: super easy set up -- works great
Review Comment: super easy set up -- works great

Title: Worked, failed, no fix but replace, just more money!!!
Review Comment: Worked great but ....for less than a year. Main unit now won't connect to two other units. All help failed. Nothing can be done!!! Very frustrating and very expensive 10 month experiment. Clearly main unit needs replaced.

Title: Worked fine for about three weeks and then just stopped
Review Comment: Worked fine for about three weeks and then just stopped. Nothing had changed on my end or my ISP end and just stopped. I have fiber into my house so took the Eero off and plugged into a laptop and got an IP , so I knew I had internet. Called them and then noticed now one of the boxes showed as out with a red symbol. Rebooted and nothing happened. Called tech support and they walked me through some things. Had me reset the box using the button on the back and the button wasn't there. The paper clip just was able to go into the device. Gave me an RMA number and figured I would just use the one in the meantime. Went out for a while and when I came back again no internet. Pulled the remaining Eero off and connected directly and had internet. Tried rebooting and nothing. Called tech support again. Walked me through a bunch of things including wiping out and redoing my network. The Eero was never able to connect. Told him to forget the RMA and I just returned the whole thing. Put a TIme Capsule on the network to use as a router it worked fine.

Title: Best wifi in ages
Review Comment: Couldn't be happier with mine. Easy setup, great customer service.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: very easy setup with no issues.

Title: I don't write many reviews but this product is great. The set up was very easy and really ...
Review Comment: I don't write many reviews but this product is great.  The set up was very easy and really increased my speed.  I bought a smart door bell and was getting 2mb outside with my door closed.  This was causing the video connection from the door to be slow.  After purchasing this I'm now getting 30mb outside the door.  I placed the pucks in the same place as my extenders in my old system.  You can see from the speed test pic that the two early dates was run when I bought the smart door bell with my old router.  The top dates are after installing eero.  Again, this is a great product!

Title: Setup process was too high of a security risk for me
Review Comment: This review is not for the eero’s wifi connection and performance, but for the setup requirements. I did not fully install the product because of privacy issues.I had read that there was an app involved in setting up the eero, but I didn't realize the amount of information that is shared via the app (as in, everything, I think). It was way too much of an invasion of my privacy, let alone the thought of someone hacking into eero’s data files and getting into any data remnants from this setup procedure.The information they initially required was:• Name• Email address• Mobile number (to send a verification code to the mobile number. Sorry, but why can’t they email it?)I grudgingly plugged in the above data (I really, really resent having to create an account for any app or product). Once the eero app found and registered the eero (which, kudos to them, took under 2 minutes), they then wanted to know:• Network name• PasswordHuh? Wha? They want me to type in my wireless account’s password into their unknown app? Are you kidding me?This was the point at which the cute little eero was boxed back up and shipped back. Sorry eero, ease of use does not mean giving up privacy in this household.(This review was going to be a single star, but since the packaging was as good as any of Apple's, and the setup process as far as it went was pain-free, I am guessing they have done a good job on the rest of their product.)

Title: Fantastic Full WiFi Coverage. Easy To Set Up and Cool Tools To Manage!
Review Comment: I installed three of these in just under four thousand square feet over two stories. Two wired and one unwired. Perfect coverage and great performance. Easy to set up with great management features. Whole installation for all three took about thirty minutes. They update themselves without any fuss.

Title: Fantastic WiFi!
Review Comment: OMG, it really works!  Worth every penny!

Title: Awesome!
Review Comment: Great coverage and fast speeds. I love not having dead zones. Also, it was easy to set up.

Title: Very satisfied. Highly recommend it.
Review Comment: Very easy and fast setup. Very good wifi speeds and no drop anywhere in the house. Very satisfied. Highly recommend it.

Title: Doesn't work through brick walls
Review Comment: We have one wall of solid brick (fireplace and surround) that blocks the WiFi to a couple of rooms. We thought this would fix it, but it doesn't really. It's only slightly better. I don't think it's worth the money for the slight improvement. Maybe it works better in other houses

Title: Amazing!
Review Comment: I bought a 3 pack as a Christmas/House warming gift for my son who just moved into a 3 story home and was hoping he already had a good system for their new home and I would be able to keep the eero.  No such luck as he hooked it up in no time and was excited about the speed and that it found his nest thermostat and smoke detectors.  They also have a studio living space above their detached garage that they will rent out and promised all utilities and didn't have a solution for wifi.  This solved that issue.That night in the guest bedroom on the third floor I tried a speed test and only registered 4.44 download and 1.45 upload. I wasn't impressed until I realized I was on their old wifi.  I switched to the eero network a minute later and registered 119.69 download and 6.20 upload.  He is on Xfinity cable.So I had to get one for myself for our three story  home  with basement and lathe and plaster walls.  I no longer have to hold my iPad up in the air, pointing to the door if I try to read email in bed!  My download speeds there went from 3.5 to 89.4.  I'm also on cable.I did have a little trouble setting it up and called their support on New Year's Eve in the morning and they didn't give me a bad time when I figured out that I hadn't screwed the cable into the modem properly as it was merely dangling like chad on a Florida ballot!  I was up and running right away!Get the full use of your internet speed!!

Title: Excellent wifi coverage!!
Review Comment: Excellent complete wifi coverage in a home with 10-13" cement block walls. This system is excellent and I have had no issues compared to previous systems that I had to constantly tweak to even get a quarter of the speeds I was paying for.

Title: The eero home wifi system is amazing! My entire house is blanketed with wifi reception ...
Review Comment: Several routers have been purchased, several router extenders tried! No routers work with extenders period! Until now.....The eero home wifi system is amazing! My entire house is blanketed with wifi reception now! My wife is not complaining about loosing her connection while watching her favorite TV show on her Ipad! Happy Wife Happy Life! Period! Best money spent in a long time!eero nice work! Extremely happy consumer! Thank You Again!

Title: 3 Story House love it
Review Comment: I live in country and always had Internet issues because my Internet is off a dish . I was a little skeptical when I got the unit,but after set up which was very easy in a few days ,everybody in my house hold was very happy. I would highly recommend this unit.

Title: Solid product that's continually improving
Review Comment: I bought these to replace my old Airport Extreme, which was having trouble reaching the other end of my 1400sqft home. I had even tried using an Airport Express to extend my network to the other end of my home but it caused a lot of issues when moving throughout the home while using a connected device.I decided to give Eero a shot. I've been pleased to see monthly firmware updates to the routers which have made a noticeable impact on speed, reliability, and the controls within the mobile apps. I also purchased an inexpensive 8-port ethernet switch which I connected to my "base" eero in order to give me more ports. This is the one I bought in case you are interested TP-Link 8-Port Gigabit Ethernet Desktop Switch (TL-SG108). All in all, I'm very pleased with the product, support team, and feature request forum. I'm a little bummed out that soon after I purchased the eero system, the price of the 3-pack came down to the same as what I paid for the 2-pack. I would've loved to have 1 more eero to place in my basement ;)

Title: It was an easy set up
Review Comment: The EERO works perfectly.  It was an easy set up.  Always a high download speed.  Never a problem.  I could not ask for anything more!

Title: Flawless Operation
Review Comment: I have been using the eero system for about a month now, and this product has proven to be everything that it claims to be! Very easy to install and set up, and flawless operation make it a product that I HIGHLY recommend. I have never had to reboot this system because of bad performance. I am covering about 3,500 square feet on three levels. It works so well that I rarely even think about it - that's how it should be!

Title: Three Stars
Review Comment: Returned. Wrong application

Title: Completely broken, support couldn't help
Review Comment: Devices constantly were disconnecting from the internet. Every 2-3 minutes it lost connection completely, causing timeouts on everything - simple web browsing to streaming media.Support suggested I switch the devices around. Didn't help. Update the devices? Wouldn't download. Send me a new device/replacement? Same problems, no improvement. I'm done. Want my money back - this thing is totally broken.

Title: Works great with Verizon FIOS
Review Comment: Works great with Verizon FIOS. Can't replace FIOS router with eero due to needed TV function but still able to have meshed wifi network throughout my house. Able to setup the three eero units hardwired to LAN with same SSID and still have regular and guest wifi function available while in bridge mode with FIOS router. (FIOS router still as used as primary for DNS/DHCP).  Wireless and wired LAN speeds for my 75/75 FIOS system are the same throughout my house. Very easy to setup. Fantastic phone support from eero team.

Title: OMG amazing, increased our wifi in our by 100%
Review Comment: OMG amazing, increased our wifi in our by 100%,I never thought i could get fast reliable internet through out my house. Thank God for eero.

Title: Unimpressed
Review Comment: I found the system slow in my less than 2k sq ft home with a couple streaming services, general browsing and networking use.  I really liked the idea and wanted it to work.  That being said, you have zip on the configuration side as far as monitoring, opening/closing ports, OpenVPN or any other "techie" settings.  This is your parents/grandparents type of device and not for someone who wants control of the edge.

Title: Would definitely recommend
Review Comment: Despite a few hiccups, the system has been great.My setup: I have a ~1400 sq ft, 2 story home. I bought 2 eeros so that I could place one downstairs (with my modem) and one upstairs where I used to have issues with connectivity. Prior to purchasing the eero system I had a tplink router and a tplink wifi extender plugged in upstairs. This worked in some cases but I had issues with devices dropping the network and even one device that would/could not connect to the wifi at all. My home has a second floor hallway which is open to the first floor.Pros: I am getting faster internet. Devices are no longer dropping off the network. All my devices can now connect. The eero looks sleek and the app is pretty easy to use.Cons: The system seems to be a bit finicky when it comes to placement of the eeros. It said to have the eero at person level but the only way I could get the upstairs eero to connect was to move the downstairs eero up onto a ~8 ft high shelf. Now, the two eeros have line of sight without any walls but it was still a little bit of a dance to get them to "see" each other. Maybe once you have them connected you can move them more easily. I don't have a need to since it works as is, but it wasn't as straight forward a process as I had hoped. Enough to make it not worth it? No. Enough to mention? I think so. Also I messed up connecting an ethernet switch, but once I explained my problem, it was updated on the help site. All in all, I think highly of the company and the product.

Title: Very happy with it
Review Comment: Very happy with it.  Used to have signal issues in a house with cbs walls and so far is working great and super fast.  Love it.

Title: All my devices have stable connections - the eero app makes administration super simple. As a point of reference
Review Comment: Works really well - I'm getting much faster streaming between network devices (I currently have Tivo Minis in other rooms that stream off a regular Tivo Premiere over wifi) - I do have FIOS so I just plugged the first eero as a router into the FIOS modem-router (and shut off all wifi antennae from the FIOS router) so all my devices now work on the eero-based network.The other thing that the eero wifi system has solved is random disconnects by devices. All my devices have stable connections - the eero app makes administration super simple. As a point of reference, I used to have the 3 router setup before where I'd manually configured them and it was a pain and very unreliable. So I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to replace a multi-router setup with something seamless like we see in modern office buildings.

Title: couldn't be more perfect. Had a 3 year old Belkin router (i ...
Review Comment: This product, other than the price, couldn't be more perfect. Had a 3 year old Belkin router (i know, sad) and needed an upgrade after dealing with buffering from the Apple TVs and overloaded access point from the Canary, Wemos and other smart devices... Took 20 minutes to set up and get things running. Outside the minor glitch of having to update the software on the main hub prior to getting a solid connection on the second eero in the office, it was seamless.Have nearly a 60% increase in speed, and buffering is non-existent in the apple TVs. Looking forward to loading them up with 30 devices with the inlaws in the coming weeks and seeing the throughput. Love the idea, and after all of my research, glad I chose this instead of the Linksys, Google, Luma or all the other ones.Highly recommend and would love to see whats coming next.

Title: Excellent way to cover your home wifi issues.
Review Comment: I set this up for a friend and decided to get one for myself, it works really well as I had issues with covering my home previously. I chose this over some other options that were out there and glad I did, the support is second to none, they even called back to follow up. Well worth the cost.

Title: Tired of slow wifi or dead zones? Not anymore.
Review Comment: Came across this little gem by chance. I did research on all the mesh network sustems out now and this seemed the best. Super easy install. Walks you through the setup. Perfect for IoT devices as well. Whole home coverage including 60+ft outside.

Title: Saved my kidney and my firstborn!
Review Comment: I rarely write reviews, but this has proven worthy of my efforts.
